Reviews.Title: “Affordable luxury”
Reviews.Author: LukeUK_12
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin is situated in an excellent location within close walking distance to Berlin Zoo, Tiergarten and other major attractions.The hotel is large and grand, very modern and very clean. The hotel bar was reasonably priced and also the room service. I would recommend this hotel for anyone looking to experience Berlin staying at a top hotel at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel but..”
Reviews.Author: PRGirlLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights in Hotel Berlin on business. The rooms are a good size and the beds are comfortable. The breakfast was a typcial range of hot and cold food. A couple of points to note: - be warned that the bathroom has a narrow window (with clear glass) that goes looks in the the bedroom from the shower (and right opposite the toilet) - okay if you're not sharing a room - the 'free' wi-fi is very low speed. You can upgrade to high speed wi-fi for 30 mins free (or pay for 24hrs - i think about €15). To do this you need to ring for a PIN number. There was no answer when I rang - if you need something doing, you will probably need to go to reception to ask. I rang the customer care number a couple of times, but didn't get an answer The team on reception were helpful with queries.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel surprised me...in a good way!”
Reviews.Author: travelexpert001
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great better than the images on their website. I was in a newly refurbished room on the second floor and would definitely return. It was modern, spacious, great shower and big screen tv. The staff were very hospitable and I was able to get an early check in and 1 hour extension on check out. Breakfast buffet was huge with chef on hand to make omelettes!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JustAddWater
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Berlin - Berlin hotel for 3 nights in April. The hotel is very conveniently located, has huge rooms (We stayed at 523), very clean, very knowledgeable and friendly staff. From Tegel airport you have to take 2 buses X9 to Zoo garten and 100 to Lützowplatz and the whole trip takes about 30 minutes. Every attraction in the city is within 2-5 stops of buses 100, 200 and MP3. You can reach Brandenburg Gate, Checkpoit Charlie and other sites within minutes. The hotel has free wifi which is a huge plus, the Julius restaurant in the ground floor has a limited menu but the selections and the wines that accompany the dishes are delicious. The waitresses and chef are very very attentive and professional. The check in and check out procedures are handled easily. The prices are very reasonable and the breakfast buffet is definitely worth to try. I would recommend this hotel to people who want quality and that extra touch of hospitality in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel, but a good walk to tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: gnttours
Reviews.Content: Reception staff great, we arrived in berlin 6 hours before check in started, our bags were put in a left luggage room, perfect. When we got to our room it was great, comfortable, clean, lovely. Pillows a bit strange, they are big square, also we were in a queen sized bed but it had 2 single quilts on it again a bit strange but very comfortable. If you are going to berlin to sightsee this hotel is a good 40 to 50 minutes walk to the brandenburg gate and reichstag however there are some lovely little cheaper bars on the walk back. The tourist bus also stops right outside and it is only a 5 minute walk to the nearest underground station. Didnt eat in the hotel but the bar is pleasant, very modern and slightly more expensive than the bars outside.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: MaliciousD
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights during easter. We took advantage of their spring offer, which offered 35% off 3 nights. The rooms were excellent. Very, very spacious with everything you need, including coffee making facilities, a fridge, etc. Comfortable bed and our room had a balcony. Rooms were cleaned daily. The staff at the hotel were very nice and helpful. I asked for directions a few times and they gave me a travel plan and maps. I did not eat at the hotel, so I cannot review their breakfast and food. Location is nice, pretty quiet area with busses right outside. You can walk to Brandenburger Tor (the walk is about 30 minutes, the bus around 10 min). It is not to far from the airport. We paid 16 euro for a taxi, but there are also busses. Negative points: No free wireless at rooms. I had to pay 16 euro for 24 hours. Overall, I can warmly recommend this hotel. For what you're paying, this is a great hotel, in my opinion. When I am going to Berlin again, which is definitely are, because it is a great city, I am going to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A BARGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Torbjorn42
Reviews.Content: Efficient check in/out. Very clean, quiet and cosy room. When booking, try to get breakfast included. Excellent variety of food and beverages. Very good location. Frendly and helpfull staff. All taxidrivers knew the hotel. Much better than expected.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect”
Reviews.Author: Pavlou_Pers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 3 nights and it was a wonderful experience. The hotel is very clean and cosy. From the reception to the rooms, you could feel the modern style. The breakfast is perfect with great variety.There was even a juice machine for making fresh juice. The pancakes were fresh and very delicious. Mini packed nutella was also available. Dinner was fine as well. The elavator was working only with the room card for safety reasons. The location is very convenient. The hotel is in workig distance from KADEWE and famous shopping street. If i ever visit Berlin again, i would visit the hotel again without any hesitation. Very well organized and run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated business-hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: Northerntraveller73
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for few nights while in conferens at Berlin. I was pleacently surprised from their newly renovated business-wing rooms: good size, excellent bathroom (showers are also for big guys like me :-) and very modern decoration with good sleaping quality. Room I stayed was just renovated and there was little paint/glue smell on the rooms and they really did have problems with aircon in the rooms but I guess that will be ok when they learn how to reset the system? I was attending to a conference with 500 people and they really managed to fit us in and also to provide good eating experience for all - not an easy task... Breakfast especially was very good with freshly squezed orange-juice, good bacon and croissants +++ Not all rooms are yet finished and the outer core of hotel needs renovation so there is still some work to do. All in all good hotel-experience with short walking distance to KaDeWe and Ku'dam

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandrosie
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel as part of a conference with over 500 delegates. Everything was so well run & just seemed to happen effortlessly. The buffet for breakfast & dinner was fabulous. The rooms were nice, clean & quiet. Staff were so friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbabe40
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Berlin-Berlin for 8 nights recently and was very happy. iI did a lot of research before I booked so I did request a room on the quiet side of the hotel but my request for a double or queen was not met, I had 2 single beds. However, the room was very comfortable, spacious, the bathroom was lovely, cleanliness very good. I did not indulge in the breakfast rather choosing the quick breakfast which was a very good choice and value for money. I found the bar staff to be excellent as well as the staff on guest relations. The deli- counter I thought was very overpriced espcially for a dried out cheese sandwich. It is not as close to restaurants and shopping as I had hoped rather a 1.4 km walk but other than that it is a great choice when staying in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good standard in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: soyporteno
Reviews.Content: Excellent location and good standard. Rooms are quite nice and very modern. The staff is ok. It is more a business hotel then a place, where couples or individual persons stay. You may not fall in love with the place but you wont have serious complaints either. The restaurant is not that convincing. You find better and cheaper food in the nearby restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “will go back”
Reviews.Author: maura192
Reviews.Content: just back today 21st march stayed for 6 nights an excellent hotel good location lovely hotel excellent staff. First time in berlin and have had a lovely experience with the city and hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Julie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights on the 10th March 12. What a lovely hotel. The staff are friendly and speak great English. Our room was big with a flat screen tv which have all the English channels such as BBC and ITV, which was a bonus after a long day out and about. There were also tea and coffee making facilities, another bonus, as well as a fridge. The beds were lovely and comfortable and everywhere in the hotel was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was great and there was everything you could want to eat. The only down side was the price of the drinks at the bar, I paid over 6 euro for one glass of wine, very overpriced. The bonus of the fridge in the room helped as you could buy drinks from the supermarket and keep them in your room. The location was great, just two stops on the u-bahn from Zoo on the U2 red line. You could walk to Zoo in about 15 minutes. Once there you can get to anywhere in the city. All in all I could highly recommend this hotel. We only paid around £150 for 3 nights with breakfast and we got this deal on hotels4u.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: kougis
Reviews.Content: Perfect location. Perfect breakfast. Clean and large rooms. Good price.

Reviews.Title: “Has a long way to go...”
Reviews.Author: ewaldbiemans
Reviews.Content: A lot better then in the past Lots of room for improvement. The hotel has come a long way in the last years as renovations are ongoing. My room had a problem with the bathroom drain and continuous sewer smell emanating from the drain. The bed is as hard as a rock and the breakfast quality is not what it was. I hear that some of the rooms were recently renovated and will try to stay in one of the new rooms next time Wifi continues to be a major complication – kicking you off and logging on is continuous….

Reviews.Title: “ELEGANCE With A FREE UPGRADE”
Reviews.Author: El G
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: Hotel Berlin offers an unbeatable nightly rate considering its elegant accommodation. The rooms are clean, spacious and had a good view of the city. We initially reserved a standard room, surprisingly, due to un-availability and current renovation at the time; we were upgraded to a suite. HB is geared primarily for business and corporate functions alike. Fortunately for us, there was no major conference during our stay. The staff (although most of them have “poker face”), are all professionals and courteous with business like attitude. We left Hotel Berlin with a lasting positive impression; therefore, without a doubt we would definitely stay there again. Hopefully, we’ll receive another FREE UPGRADE. TRAVEL DATES: September-2009 LOCATION: Centrally located; Plenty of restaurant and shopping opportunities within the city square; Close to public transportation. Close to a public park which is perfect for leisure walk. POSITIVE NOTES: Elegant accommodation; Unbeatable Price; Centrally located; Professional staff; Clean and spacious rooms; NEGATIVE NOTES: Our room was a little walk from the elevator. AMENITIES: AC; Free Wi-Fi; Flat Screen TV; In-room Safe; Hairdryer; Clock/Radio; Business Center; On-site Restaurant; NIGHTLY RATE: $130+ booked via Travelocity DISCOUNT ACCEPTED: None NOTES: Please click the green “YES” button below if you find this review helpful. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL BERLIN - BERLIN”
Reviews.Author: Lyn1990
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel - central to most areas. Friendly good service - I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a potential, yet need to improve”
Reviews.Author: Tamer H
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here during a business trip as it was few steps away from the meeting spot. The price was good for a five star hotel. (It was during Berlinale - peak time !) My room was spacious, but there was no wardrobe, no bench for putting the luggage. I had to keep the clothes ın the luggage laying on the carpet. Probably they will provide more facilities in future; because I felt that the renovation is continueing. I was woken up by the drilling and hammering; luckily at a reasonable hour. I think this will not continue forever, so should not frighten potential customers. The WLAN was free of charge, but this was a gift of the booking agency; so choose it wisely and ask at the reception first. The breakfast is extremely overpriced, still you can have a croissant and coffee for few euros at the hotel. If I come to Berlin for the same meeting I will probably look for a room here; the listed negative issues may then be resolved.

Reviews.Title: “******WARNING : NOT IN MITTE AT ALL!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Alex P
Reviews.Content: Dear All, I choose this hotel because it looked interesting and especially, it said the location was in the MITTE district, this means City Center. Unfortunately, upon my arrival from the airport, when I asked the cab driver about the Mitte, he just laughed, saying it was PERIPHERY, not Mitte at all. I was in town to attend the Film Festival (Berlinale), which actually took place in the MITTE, and I spent most of my time in a Taxi to reach the different venues. Furthermore, I managed to spend more on Taxis over 3 days, than on food, drinks and shopping combined!!!! Also, this place is for CONFERENCES and BUSINESS. If you are looking for a couples place, something personal, or with a Berlin Feel, AVOID AVOID AVOID this monster.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel”
Reviews.Author: OlgaandJan
Reviews.Content: If you like anonymity, this is the place to be. Almost 700 rooms on 7 floors. It is massive, overcrowded place. Reception is very modern and efficient. The brekfast place is very big, with more buffets to get everybody through. Breakfast is good. For dinner we had to wait for 1 1/2 hour before the food came. that was a waste of time. The room is ok (size), but the bed not. Cushion is to soft, and there are two duvets on the queen size bed. My duvet was falling all the time when I turn in my sleep. It was in Eastern Europe in the past that I had beds like this. I cannot remember in my traveling the last 10 years that I had a bed like this. I did not sleep well for two nights due to this problem. The wifi was good, announced as costing € 19,- per day, but is was free. Very good. I made a mistake with the parking garage and was set by the concierge at my place. He asked why did you not listen to me when I gave you instructions, but I tried to tell him that I did not had any contact with teh concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service - not here”
Reviews.Author: ChilternFlyer
Reviews.Content: As a seasoned business traveller I found this hotel's attention to detail sadly lacking. Stuff goes wrong anywhere - its how you put it right that counts. Be warned if it goes wrong there is no follow through - shame because fundamentally it could be a good package apart from tiny beds.

Reviews.Title: “For Business Only”
Reviews.Author: Peter084
Reviews.Content: This hotel exists for one purpose only - to serve Business people in need of a fully functioning Business hotel. It does that job quite well. Reception is spacious and well manned meaning queues were fast moving. The rooms are clean, tidy and come with (limited) desk space and free wifi. Bathrooms are fine although the shower is not powered and as such is a disappointment. TV channels include a good selection of UK channels - a home from home. The breakfast room is big but still manages to feel overly full as the self service food area is tightly packed. The bar area is poor - too small and it is sometimes hard to get served. It is also in direct line with the Hotel's front door so the minus 16 temperatures outside made the bar very cold. Having stayed a few time in Berlin I would say there are better Business hotels than this.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Tab2Tab
Reviews.Content: Me and a pal stayed at this hotel the week in between Xmas and New Year. It's in a good location close to Underground etc. and buses. The room was comfortable and the bathroom was a good size with a great shower. The staff were helpful and multi-lingual, so no problems for us as we speak no German. We did the breakfast (as an extra) one morning, but thought it a little pricey at €21, after all, there is only so much you can eat at breakfast. I would stay again as I plan to visit Berlin again in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: jensbo
Reviews.Content: Very central location close to the Tiergarten. Bus 100 stops close to the hotel and the U-Bahn is within short walking distance making Hotel Berlin, Berlin an excellent point of departure for the exploration of Berlin. The room was good, the breakfast buffet excellent and the WiFi worked well. All in all value for money. Restaurant Locher accross the square is a good venue for a delicious dinner and the original Cafe Einstein is close by.

Reviews.Title: “Decent stay in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: smiah79
Reviews.Content: Great stay at Hotel Berlin. Decent location with easy access to most places. We were on a "lads" holiday but this is more of a business hotel with most guests being reps and sales people by the looks of things with a few tourists thrown in. The staff are very courteous and helpful. The rooms are a little basic, but then again this is not a 5 star hotel and it suited our needs on this trip. The hotel recepetion is very modern and brightly coloured. The gym and sauna are is very good and we spent a fair of time here. The buffet breakfast was very good and hand plenty ot offer. Overall its a good hotel in a safe area which is good value for money too. Definitley worth considering.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Hotel in a Great Area”
Reviews.Author: jsmartinez
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Hotel Berlin, Berlin, and it proved to be a great choice. The hotel is modern and attractive with reasonable rates. The rooms had been recently renovated and are quite attractive and comfortable. The only reason I would not award it 5 stars is that it was rather too warm at night. You can open the windows--which we did--but then the noise from the busy street is too loud. If I could have cooled off the room without opening the windows it would have been perfect. The staff was attentive and friendly, and the location is a short walk from the Nollendorf U-Bahn and near many reasonably priced restaurants. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: KezzaKKC
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for a 3 night budget break over Christmas. Pros Good, friendly staff. Reasonable sized room. Comfortable beds. Good selection of channels on TV. Well priced. Easily accessed from the airport (Tegel) and close to a metro station. Cons Duvets a little too small for the beds as they easily slid off during the night. No anti-slip mat for the bath so when using the shower and trying to climb out you have to be careful not to slip and hurt yourself. It's a very large hotel covering an entire block and our room on the 5th floor was probably about as far from the main elevators as it was possible to be. For some strange reason there seems to be a typical German efficiency in the allocation of drink ingredients in the room! On discovering that there were only three teabags (one Indian/British style, one Peppermint and one Fruit) I asked reception for more 'traditional' teabags, and was given a handful of extra bags. However, when the room was cleaned during the day, and the stock replenished, I was amused to discover that the extra teabags had been taken away and we were once again left with just three (one of each)!! Breakfast is very expensive (21 Euro). There's a reasonable range of items to choose from with overall good quality. We discovered that there was an egg station AFTER we had eaten - it's hidden away in a corner of the restaurant and you won't discover it if you're seated in a certain area. Overall it's a good hotel at 55 Euros per night for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in former west Berlin”
Reviews.Author: ggabi
Reviews.Content: This old hotel is well prepared for the future! Excellent rooms, not so big but with everything you would expect in a good quality hotel! Excellent restaurants, not very far from public transportation, nice neighborhood with many parks,good business center. Better than expected!

Reviews.Title: “Second Time Staying Here - Simply Love It”
Reviews.Author: Ger W
Reviews.Content: Once again we stayed in the Hotel Berlin, Berlin at the start of December (previously stayed here May 2010). We brought our extended family with us and everyone thought the best thing about our trip was the hotel! We purchased a classic room in January for our trip in December, directly through the hotel. As the hotel is undergoing renovation, we were given a Business Room instead of the Classic Room (fantastic rooms currently undergoing renovation to Premium Rooms - they came with a comfortable sitting area). All I can say is that the rooms in this hotel are so big and comfortable, it doesnt matter what kind of room you get. I wouldnt consider staying anywhere else in Berlin. In the past I have stayed in various Berlin hotels including the Kempinski on Ku'damm, the Artotel and Centrovital in Spandau, but this hotel is the best. Firstly as a business class hotel you get a level of attention you wouldnt get elsewhere. Check in is so quick and efficient, reception staff are so helpful. Room service is fantastic and the household staff are friendly and welcoming. The rooms are surprisingly big, spacious and comfortable (order harder pillows though if necessary - traditionally in Europe pillows are soft). The furnishings and decoration are modern, clean and well maintained. Plenty of storage in the large wardrobe for cases etc. Great sized bathroom with a fantastic shower, showergels etc. And English TV! Always a plus. Breakfast is expensive but there are plenty of great restaurants and cafes nearby for food. Cafe Einstein being my favourite. The bar serves lovely food (Berlin Burger highly recommended!) and cocktails. Nice and atmospheric in the evening after a long day shopping at the Christmas Markets : ) As its a business hotel, conferences are held in the conference room across from the bar. But this isnt a problem. It seems the conferences finish early evening leaving guests of the hotel free to lounge in the bar. The location is perfect. The bus 100 is right outside the hotel and goes directly from the Zoo to Alexanderplatz. The tour buses also stop here! Witttenburg Platz and Nollendorfplatz U bahn are a short stroll away. KaDeWe is about a five minute walk. Its ideally located in the centre and so easy to get to and from the hotel. There is also a taxi rank across the road from the hotel. The current renovations had no impact on our stay whatsoever, and I believe they will be finished in March 2012. I am staying here again in January 2012 for our 6th visit to Berlin and will hopefully get to see the new rooms on our 7th visit sometime in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: topcat1972
Reviews.Content: We visited Berlin as part of our honeymoon and we were not disappointed. The hotel was in a very good location and the room was excellent. Taxi's were readily available outside if necessary and the ubahn was a 5 minute walk away. The hotel had a huge lobby with takeaway food available. There was no wifi in the rooms only in the lobby area. We didnt experience the restaurant for breakfast so cannot comment. There is a lovely department store Ka de We not far away and it has a great gourmet floor which is a must visit. This was my first experience of Berlin and the hotel was a great addition.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in a lovely city”
Reviews.Author: anastasiaEngland
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fairly well located. Very near the Zoo Train Station, and the very nice department store KA de WE. We had a business room, which was fairly spacious, nice bed, (if you like hard pillows, you need to ask for them) tea and coffee facilities, which comes incredibly handy when you come back from walking the city on a cold day. Bathroom very clean. Very good shower, towels slightly small, and not very many, and a bottle of shampoo, soap and body wash all in one. We did not try the breakfast or any other meal in the hotel. There is a very good italian restaurant Valentino very near the hotel. All in all a good hotel at a very reasonable price. Our checking in was the quickest we had that I can remember. We were the only ones arriving but I have waited for ages in other hotels with nobody around. The receptionist was friendly and very efficient. I must point out that the room had a lot of noise from constant traffic. If the noise bothers you, take a room indoors not facing the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great But Extras Were Expensive”
Reviews.Author: LilRedFoxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights on vacation. The staff was very courteous and helpful throughout our stay. Our room was very nice, simply and tastefully decorated roomy and quiet. We were on the fourth floor and could only hear traffic when we left the window open. There was a tiny fridge instead of a mini-bar and it worked out better for us. You can purchase drinks and snacks at the front counter as needed. The hotel was very busy, but not overwhelming. The location was great---there were restaurants and cafes and grocery stores very close, and the Europa Center was well within walking distance. Plenty of shopping is nearby. Cabs are always out front if you don't feel like walking. The only downside to this hotel is that they charge for wi-fi, and breakfast was NOT included in our booking. We paid 20 Euro pp for breakfast! I've stayed at 5-star hotels that wouldn't dream of charging for breakfast...especially at that rate. However, the breakfast was good. Wi-fi was expensive as well, but the speed was fine. We will stay here again when we visit Berlin, but we'll make sure to go out for breakfast and to skip the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay, always good”
Reviews.Author: jtontravels
Reviews.Content: Smart, clean straightforward hotel. Great value. Should offer free WiFi though.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, good all round hotel”
Reviews.Author: pkonline84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Berlin, Berlin for 4 nights. Rooms were larger than expected, had all the basics, we're clean, although had some initial problems which were very quickly sorted after a call to reception. Staff always very polite and helpful. Tv had a number of English language channels. Breakfast was included in out room and was superb - very large range of foods, in a lovely, light setting. I would recommend this hotel for a short stay in Berlin and would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great.”
Reviews.Author: Jesse G
Reviews.Content: First of all, the staff are very friendly and the location is more than acceptable. The cosmopolitan look of the hotel and the lively hotel bar scene each evening was enjoyable as well, my only concern is that the room we stayed in seemed as though it might be part of a different hotel. The furniture in the "classic" room was rather dated, the in-room amenities were sparse and the beds were not the most comfortable I have ever slept in. However, it was clean and secure, no question. Next time I would spend a little more and upgrade to another type of room, because the more modern areas of the hotel seemed in great shape with tasteful decor. The "classic" room is still perfect for anyone travelling on a budget, and it's great that the hotel offers such an option for those frugal travelers. It simply wasn't the sort of room I'm used to, so next time I return I will make a point to book something a little higher up the line. Still, overall, a good stay and can't say enough about the helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidePiras
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel I've ever been, people so friendly and helpful, breakfast a bit expensive but worth every single penny with such selection of cold and warm food and a cook ready to prepare you wonderful omelettes. next time we go to Berlin we definitely go to this hotel again, the sauna and fitness room are available for free for all guests and are perfectly kept and organized.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Dew's
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times this year (2011), all on business trips. It's been good value for money - especially for a city centre hotel in a European capital, and every room I have stayed in has been in very good condition. The service at reception is swift and efficient, the beds are comfortable, the bathrooms very clean. The rooms do not have over-priced minibars - instead, you can purchase items at reception at a more reasonable cost. There is free WiFi in room. The corridors are carpeted and it is quite hard to hear people moving around outside the rooms. Breakfast is very comprehensive, and service is attentive without being oppressive. My only complaint is that the hotel tends to assume I wish to pay in GB pounds without asking, which is a nuisance as my company expects Euros in continental Europe!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with retro touch”
Reviews.Author: Damascene48
Reviews.Content: Although I asked for a large double bed and was provided with atwin beded room, the staff were applogotic and sent me the housekeeping staff to join the two beds. The hotel theme is as its name suggests, the city of Berlin, with many pictures of the city adorning the rooms and hallways. The breakfast is full of choices both typical German cooked breakfast as well as a wide variety of options for the more continental pronged folks like myself. Howev I found the price quite high at Euros 21! The other drawback is that the hotel provided wifi connection at a charge Euros 9.95 per day!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location, we will be back in 2012.”
Reviews.Author: SheldonCole
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights from 21 October with our 3 children aged 14, 12 and 7. Arrived 11pm, check in was friendly and quick. We had booked 2 double rooms, and were given room numbers 518 and 523 which were fine and one of which featured a readily made up bed which we needed for our third child. I had an excellent Currywurst, pommes frites and large beer at the bar. It was Handy that you could buy sandwiches, crisps, snacks and drinks by Reception. The hotel was clean and the staff friendly and efficient. On the day we left we were allowed to leave our luggage at the hotel all day at no charge. When we picked it up in the evening they called for a taxi for us and loaded the luggage into it for us. Many of the staff speak English. All in all, we were very pleased with the hotel and it is well located being close to the Zoo and KDW. Berlin itself is an amazing, historic city with so much to see and do. The German people we met were all friendly and polite. We shall return to Berlin for another break in 2012, and will stay at the Hotel Berlin again. Sheldon & Becky Cole, Taunton, England.

Reviews.Title: “Value for your Money”
Reviews.Author: WalterTrump
Reviews.Content: At £60 per night room only, good value for money. Centrally located between Tiergarten & Kurfurstendamm. Ideally located for bus/underground transport. Spacious clean rooms, well maintained with nice bar area. Check in/out fast & efficient. Did not use restaurant. WARNING breakfast is steep at 21 euros per head. Couple of negatives, outside traffic noise is loud, particularly at night. Pillows were awful, too soft, make sure you request additional firm pillows. Overall goood value for money.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Berlin for the money”
Reviews.Author: Chris P
Reviews.Content: Ideally located (along the route of the famous Berlin City route 100 bus, which is virtually running all day every day, every 5 minutes frequency). Stunning quality hotel, smart modern decor and the friendliest welcome possible. Rooms are all tremendously clean and extremely well kept. Staff are ueber-helpful and even suggested a sightseeing tour that we ensure we saw the main attractions during our stay. We were with a small baby and the stay could not have been better. I stay in many hotels every year on business and for leisure and this is truly one of the best. Do not hesitate - I recommend unreservedly - for business or pleasure, the perfect base when in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Nice comfortable stay.”
Reviews.Author: RadixLecti
Reviews.Content: I've been staying in Berlin Berlin three different times. Hotel is good value for the money in good location. Only downsides are quite expensive breakfast and wifi.

Reviews.Title: “Gross, freundlich, gut”
Reviews.Author: AnnalenaP
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin Berlin is a good place to stay on your Berlin travel. It`s located o.k., after a 3 minute walk you reach the Metro which connects you in no-time with the most important sights of the city. The rooms are big and nice, although ours smelled like cigars - even though it was a non-smoker room. The staff was really friendly and always happy to help. Our room wasn`t exceptionally clean which is a shame for a 4 star accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Quite good!”
Reviews.Author: loveknot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip. Really big and busy hotel, very conference and bus tour oriented. Gave me the wrong room twice, second time walked into a room and an airline pilot was getting changed....woops! Receptionists seem stressed so the friendly factor isn't entirely fitting for Berlin which is usually super friendly and warm (personality...not the weather!!). Room was ok, bit smelly......a musky smell which is offputting. Toiletries in the bathroom limited and if you need anything else it's 1Eur50 per item. Good nights sleep. Try and work out the room entertainment system......good luck! No bathrobes/minibar was empty. Great location though and they recommended me a great little German restaurant nearby where they serve an excellent schnitzel at a great price. Breakfast was good, again the place is so busy the staff seem overworked, you keep having to ask for things like tea constantly. Would recommend it for a short stay at a very reasonable 100 EUR per evening. Stayed in more luxurious places in Berlin but this place would certainly do.

Reviews.Title: “Any hotel, Anywhere.. but good”
Reviews.Author: zungazung
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be any hotel, any place in the world, which is both advantageous and not. You know what you'll get and it provides it well, with pleasant and attentive staff. Clean, safe location, fine in a small city although tourist highlights are probably not on the doorstep - depends what you consider to be a highlight though! But also means the hotel is a refuge after a day out and about. Food was eminently missable, so we did. I thought it provided an excellent base for a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good business hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: will in sf
Reviews.Content: We stayed five nights at this hotel. It is a new hotel, very modern inside. Most of the guests seemed to be businessmen; we could tell by walking through the lobby that there was an appliance convention in town. The room was big enough for two, had adequate storage, and a comfortable bed. The room was quiet even though it was on the street side of the building. What we liked most was the location and access to public transportation. The double-decker number 100 bus stops in front of the hotel and can take you through the Tiergraten, past the Reichstag and down Unten den Linden. The U-Bahn stop -- Nollendorfplatz -- is 200 meters from the hotel; three different lines pass through this stop. The desk staff, of course, spoke English -- most of the time better than mine. They were friendly, helpful, and efficient. There is a nice bar/patio in the court yard.

Reviews.Title: “Large clean modern hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Koalakaye
Reviews.Content: This is a fairly modern hotel in Berlin. It is close to the train station so makes it an easy trip into town or to other sites around Berlin. My room was very large and clean. It had a little coffee table and chairs and a small bar fridge to keep your cold stuff in. The hotel has a bar down stairs which is handy after a long day sight seeing! The hotel is very large and the breakfast rooms are huge. There are several smaller buffets which have cereal, sausages, eggs, fruit, toast, tea and coffee, dried fruit and nuts. Not a bad selection.

Reviews.Title: “Colorful Hotel with good rooms.”
Reviews.Author: modernmarcopolo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights in August . Must say that the stay was very comfortable and enjoyable. The highlight of this hotel is the colorful lobby and dining area. Breakfast is very good and has two well laid out buffets , to avoid over crowding. Rooms are very large and have a separate sitting area. The service at the concierge desk was very poor . The guy had very little knowledge about the local must see attractions. The hotel is very popular with tour operators , you should avoid this place if you dislike large touristy groups ! I had to wait for my room for almost one hour at check in.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, modern, roomy and clean, but expensive internet..”
Reviews.Author: espangen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days in July 2011. The hotel is modern, clean, the lobby area is roomy and nice, the room was a nice one too. Definitely of the better. Staff was friendly and helpful, both to me speaking german and other people in our group only speaking english. I have one thing to complain about: You get 30 minutes free internet per room, then you have to pay an outrageous price. This is in 2011 ridiculous, as you get free unlimited internet even at a €10/night hostel. We ended up bringing our laptops around the corner to a café having free wi-fi. Not a big issue, but when paying that much for a 4-star hotel, I don't expect to pay anything for internet access. Parking in the hotel parking lot is expensive too, many times more expensive than a normal street parking in the adjacent streets.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it and well be back”
Reviews.Author: daliasiani
Reviews.Content: very good location,near ka de we.near buses.good rome.very good breakfast.nice yard.friendly stuff

Reviews.Title: “Very good location.”
Reviews.Author: trimithiotis
Reviews.Content: All services provided are excellent. All the places of the Hotel were very clean. The buffet breakfast was rich. Roomy lounge and Bar.

Reviews.Title: “Good buffet breakfast and good rooms”
Reviews.Author: thcthchk
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for a 3 night city break to Berlin. We have been to other EUropean cities such as Paris, Lille, Brussels, Amsterdam etc, and this was the best hotel we have ever stayed in. In the other cities, we have stayed in small rooms with no service or breakfast. Hotel Berlin was nothing as such - the room was spacious and properly designed, with comfortable bed, lots of corridor space, and a clean and elegant toilet. It is not a 5-star hotel, and was not decorated in a luxurious manner, but it was simply comfortable and clean. The buffet breakfast, included in the room price, was great - they kept the buffet filled up till the last minute. There were bacon, local sausages, waffle & pancakes, juices, museli, fresh pineapple and watermelon. We had breakfast and siply skipped lunch. The service was excellent. The gym came with a sauna, all included in the room price, and it was a properly fitted out gym (unlike other 4-star hotels we have been, which simply converted a small room into a 'gym' with 2 treadmills and a water dispenser). THe sauna was very good and we loved it. All in all, a very good hotel which made our weekend break a pleasant one

Reviews.Title: “Up and down opinion”
Reviews.Author: notkeepingmum
Reviews.Content: Pros: A great rate with hotels.com of 210 euros for 3 nights for two people. Reception very impressive in decor, nice style, bar and outside "beach" were great with a nice buzz and atmostphere. Close to Kadewe and the open top bus tour, metro etc. On arrival the room we took was clean. Cons : Reception staff rude and unhelpful Room upgrade we paid for was dubious Tried to book us into a room with double bed after we requested two singles, then insisted a normal room on their website was actually an executive suite we had paid for. Breakfast not included in the price Noisy main road outside our room. Cleaner didn't keep up standards during our stay. Also, i had bought my friend some chocolates, of which some disappeared and the foil was left on the floor by the wastepaper bin in the bathroom!!! Tea and coffee not refilled unless we called down and requested it - and it took 70 odd minutes for this to happen. Mixed feelings, i would only recommend if you got a really good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Personal is very unfriendly”
Reviews.Author: LAVAC
Reviews.Content: In the most of the cases they answered like they were doing a fovour to me. They told the things one time and if I didn't understand they were indifferent. They didn't inform me about important points during the check-in, they didn't try to translate what they were saying etcetera. I will not back to this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the Berlin experience”
Reviews.Author: silvertigress
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the first to be built after the war according to our tour guide as we passed it on our open top bus tour on the second day. It is a large hotel well located a 10 minute walk from the zoo. The hotel itself is modern, clean and spacious. one tip I would give you is not to use the phone to call home. a 12 minute call to Scotland cost me 15.60 euros, far better off calling from a phone box!!!! getting to the hotel. we came from schoenfield airport . we bought the ABC welcome card at the airport, but you could have got it at the train station from one of the red machines. please please follow this advice though!!! only stamp/validate the ticket ( in the wee red boxes on the platform) once just on your first journey. you don't need to stamp it again for any further journeys. we did and got thrown off the train coming back from a day trip and charged a 40 euro fine because we thought we had to stamp it every journey. on arriving at the station we followed the advice from other reviewers but could not find the express train mentioned. So we ended up going to platform three and getting the train to Dessau. We got off at zoo and then we were lost!!! if you want to walk to the hotel when you come out of the station and you can see the zoo in front of you turn right and just and walk to the top of the street. then turn left and keep walking straight down that road. or when you get to infront of the zoo ( you will see the elephant gate) cross the road and get on the number 100. this is a great bus service and stops at all the main sites such as the Reichstag, Brandenburg gate etc but even better than that it stops at Lutoplatz just in front of the hotel. the next stop comes up on the display well in advance, just remember to press the stop button!! in the end we ended up getting a taxi to the hotel which cost 5 euro 60 cents. Even although we had paid in full in advance (and so didn't bring our credit card) we were charged a deposit of 50 euros per night which would be returned to us upon checkout. This is something you really need to know if you are a traveller on a budget like we were and have booked and paid in full in advance. we stayed on the 5th floor. There was very little noise. The rooms were clean and spacious and decorated in a modern style. The mattresses were very squishy yet comfortable. you only get one large rather squishy square shaped pillow, we didn't ask for more but I assume you could have. We has a safe in our room which we could programme which was free of charge and the TV has a number of English speaking channels, BBC, ITV etc which are also complimentary. best of all was the wee fridge in the room. it enabled us to nip across to netto just up the street and buy some breakfast essentials as we didn't opt for breakfast at the hotel. Diet coke aka coke light is very expensive in Berlin! I got one from the kiosk at hotel reception and was charged 3 euros for the pleasure. However This was actually comparable in cost to plenty of other shops we saw in Berlin, even bottled water was on the expensive side compared to other countries in Europe I have visited. we nearly died one night when we went to the Irish bar and got charged 13 euros 20 for 1 bulmers and 1 gin and bitter lemon!!! it was quite hot and humid when we were there and doing a lot of walking about cold drinks were needed regularly! The customer service team were great at the hotel and nothing was a problem for them. The receptionists spoke English and were helpful giving us a map to help us get around. when we left to get back to the airport we got the bus from the stop on the square outside the front entrance no. 100 bus to freidrichstrasse and then we went to that station and caught the airport express from platform one. May I strongly recommend to anyone travelling to Berlin for a few days to visit Sachsenhausen in the town of oranienberg. It was something I felt I simply had to see. we took the number 100 bus to friedrichstrasse. got off walked up the street to friedrichstrasse station and got the s1 s-bahn train to oranienberg. then we did the 20 minute walk ( well signposted- or you can get the bus) to Sachsenhausen. you will need to leave I.D as a deposit for an audioguide (3 euros) and a map (0.50 cents) but you get this back when leaving. Also you have to make a reservation to visit the pergammon museum which I was disapointed by as I the didn't get to see it. Reichstag too has to be booked three days in advance. Berlin was a great city to visit and we happened to be there for the 50th anniversary commemoration of the building of the wall. This hotel I would definatley recommend as a good base to explore Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel to get the most out of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: Adam Y
Reviews.Content: Cannot recommend this hotel enough. The staff were extremely helpful and informative. The hotel itself is gorgeous, we got bumped up to a better room when we arrived and it was beautiful. Big beds, big bathroom, desk and table. The entertainment system is built into the TV with masses of channels and loads of UK channels. We ate in the bar and had room service once, food is good and moderately priced. The hotel is a short walk to a well connected underground station, get a day pass and you can travel anywhere across the city quickly and cheaply. There are a few nice places to eat very close to the hotel, just wander around and you will find plenty.

Reviews.Title: “It could have been good but there were too many buts..”
Reviews.Author: Haim_1
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good things. The hotel is very clean and breakfest is very good and at a high quality. Now to what should be even more interesting, the bottom line is that I will never stay at this hotel again and I reccomand all couples to avoid it. When we arrived at the hotel at about 11:00 (after a sleepless night) we recieved a room (1516) that was suposed to be as we booked, double bed none-smoking. We were notofied that we got a 2 levels upgarade from classic to business room. BUT when we entered the room we discovered a twin bed. I went down to the front desk and the lady said that this is what they have at the moment and if we like she will move us to another room (1526) with a king-size double bed. She pronissed that House keeping will attend to it immidiatly, but it will take some time to clean. We went out for almost 3 hours. We came back at 14:30 BUT the room was not ready for us. We waited 20 monutes more got the key went into the room BUT it was a twin bed, once again. It was too much for us and after a while the lady in the front desk said that any booking is just a guest wish BUT they do not promise to fulfil it. I thanked her for giving us a room and not a sleeping bag in the garage and decided I'm not going to fight it any more. I didn't want to destroy my entier vacation for being mad at an idiot at reception. The room shot have been a high level (businees at a 4 star hotel) BUT the room amenties were limited to empty fidge that used to be a mini-bar, safe, TV, Air-conditioner, coffe making corner, and two soap dispencers in the bath room (they calim shampoo and soap is the same). BUT no shower cap, no shampoo, no hair conditionaer. They provide 4 towels (hands and shower) BUT the two larger ones are significantly smaller than what I know from many other hotels. Now to the upgrade - it must have been a joke and the joke is on me. The business room is much smaller than the clasic (look at the hotel web site) 24m2 instead of 36m2 and with a higher standard funitures.

Reviews.Title: “So much more than I expected...”
Reviews.Author: clintonuws
Reviews.Content: Ok... I see how some might judge this as a very "typical hotel" like any standard Hilton or similar. It is a very large hotel and seems to be used by a lot of tour groups and airlines for their staff for overnights. But... booking on a travel website, I only paid $77/night. Hotel is nice, clean, has a small gym, has saunas (didn't use that). It is right on the 100 bus line and about 3 blocks from one of the gay neighborhoods (but if you weren't gay, you'd never know). I booked the classic room and am pretty sure they upgraded me into a renovated room. It was so large that there was tons of room for all of our luggage (4 large bags). Only slight concern was that the tub is large and very smooth. Everytime I stepped out, I thought how easy it would be to slip and fall (and I'm a 42yo male). Hotel offers umbrellas for use for free when it rains.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite four star”
Reviews.Author: qcentury
Reviews.Content: The hotel lists itself as a four-star property, and first appearances go along with this. The central areas, lobby, and hotel bar are all very light and modern. But our room seemed stuffy and dated. Not terrible. But not a four star room, either. The main bed was just barely comfortable and the pull-out sofa bed was bad news indeed. Our kids tolerated it, but I would absolutely not ask an adult to sleep there. On the positive side, the staff were helpful and friendly, especially given they were handling a huge resident conference, and the location is very good - just steps away from a Number 100 bus stop, which takes a tourist just about anywhere she might want to go!

Reviews.Title: “Big but inspiring”
Reviews.Author: Poul H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin Berlin is a rather big hotel, and if you pay the low rates you get the rooms in the end of the long corridors. However, dont fear that - the corridors are nicely decorated and even the rooms ain the end have the same high standard as any other og the rooms. The rooms have a good size - over avarage actually. It is very clean, and very nicely decorated and furnised. One big + is the welness/fitness center in the basement - it is really awsome. I think the hotel is properly quite expensive if you book directly, but because of the size you can often find cheap rooms on external hotel booking websites. This hotel location is exellent close to Nollendorf Platz with all the nice bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel - I would return and recommend it to anyone visiting Berlin.”
Reviews.Author: purplerose239
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Berlin, Berlin is a huge, modern, hotel. My partner and I had a pleasant stay there and would be happy to return again someday. Location: The location is very good. It is situated about a 5-10 minute walk from the U Bahn and there are local bus services nearby. There are shops and restaurants within a short walking distance. The area feels safe when walking around at night. Staff: Professional, approachable and happy to help with any requests. Every staff member we dealt with was able to speak English. Room: I paid for a classic room but was given a superior room which was nice. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were too soft for my liking. We had a double bed but single duvets but it was fine that way. There was a TV, small refrigerator, 2 bedside tables, a phone, 2 chairs, a small table, a large mirrored wardrobe with coat hangers, shelves and a safe inside. It had carpeted flooring. The room was a good size and was well decorated. Inside the information booklet in the room it mentions complimentary internet for use in rooms and this was the case sometimes but other times we attempted to log on and it was asking we pay 15.95. So sometimes it worked, sometimes it didn't. We didn't require it very much to query it but I'm not sure what was going on with the Internet. Bathroom: The bathroom had tiled walls and floors with a bath/shower, a sink and a toilet. There is a large wall mirror and an attached magnifying mirror on the wall. There was a hairdryer in the bathroom and shaving sockets. The hotel provides a bottle of shampoo/soap/body wash combo on the wall in the shower and at the sink. Two hand towels and two bath towels were provided. The bathroom was very clean and the water was always hot when required with good water pressure in the shower. Restaurant: We did not use the hotel restaurant for breakfast or dinner. To be fair, I think asking for 21 euro per person is excessive, it doesn't matter how big and varied the breakfast is said to be; one can only eat so much in the morning! We couldn't justify 42 euro per day for our breakfast and instead it is possible to store milk in the refrigerator for cereal bought from a nearby store or visit a nearby cafe or pick up a pastry for 1 euro in the U Bahn station before heading out for the day. Similarly, the restaurant seemed expensive and this was off putting. In saying that, the restaurant menu did look nice and if you can afford it then feel free to ignore this bit. However, I would recommend the hotel bar meals which are slightly cheaper if you don't feel like leaving the hotel for dinner. Bar: The hotel bar serves drinks, meals and snacks. The staff were friendly. They have a good cocktail menu. Drinks are a little expensive but being a hotel bar that's probably to be expected. The bar was a nice place to sit for the evening when it was pouring with rain outside. When it is sunny there is an outdoor area which is nice to sit in when having a drink. The food was tasty here too. I cannot fault the services I used and overall I enjoyed my stay at the Hotel Berlin, Berlin and would be happy to return here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Ayr753
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and very good rooms. Free wireless internet and very clean. Well served by the 100 bus into the Unter den linden and the 200 bus to the Ku'dam. The U-bahn is only a 5 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice for a trip in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: serserou
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 nights with my spouse during a cold but romantic German winter. The hotel is huge as it covers an entire city block! The decoration to the public places is contemporary and at the rooms too. There is a renovated wing of the hotel but we didn’t saw it as we placed at the old one that was maybe medium but not bad at all. The breakfast at this hotel was by far the most various we’ve ever seen, even with a chef preparing live custom-made omelets. The hotel is not very close to the major sightseeing of Berlin but there is convenient connection through the nearby metro station. There are also some bars and restaurants in the surrounding area, pretty convenient for us. What I liked most in that hotel (besides the Guinness record breakfast) was the saunas in the health centre (that guests visit for free), essential for us after our walking tours in the cold city!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very good, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: zmirianc
Reviews.Content: We took a business room without breakfast, the room was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice service”
Reviews.Author: Chaim28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Berlin is in a good location, more or less in the middle of Berlin. I liked the German breakfast a lot, especially the coffee was very good. The staff were friendly and helpful. Room was clean and well sized. Bathtub and shower and quality amenities. Watch out for weekend specials.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel centrally located bar very busy with conference business”
Reviews.Author: Billybombshells
Reviews.Content: Theres a Charge for WIFI use the computer located in lobby, also if breakfast is not included eat at a cafe locally for 5-10 euro as opposed to over 20 in hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: dave1888
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 5 nights after the mostly positive reviews on tripadvisor. First impressions of the hotel were wonderful, the receptionist spoke very good English after realising our German wasnt too great! We paid for the most basic double room and as such were not expecting an awful lot for the price, but to our surprise the room was great! Very clean, flat screen TV, coffee table and furniture, and the fridge was a bonus too. The bathroom was fantastic too. I`m not sure if the balcony was designed for anything else other than housing an air conditioning unit, but it was pretty filthy and the door stayed firmly closed. We sadly did not use the fantastic looking eating facilities at the hotel, 21euro for breakfast was simply too expensive, and we much preferred to be out discovering the many Berlin eateries for lunch. The dining area did look wonderfully modern and the bar was pretty well stocked. The main appeal of this hotel was the location, it is very central but still a quiet enough area to go for late afternoon walks to Tiergarten, or the walk the other direction to the bustling Nollendorfplatz. The famous 100 bus stops less than a 1 minute walk from the hotel too. Public transport to every corner of Berlin is very easily reached from the hotel. The area felt very safe at night, though there were more than a few hookers in the area on our way back from the U-bahn each night, but hey, what city doesnt. Walking around the area at night felt very safe and relaxing, especially on a warm summer night! We checked out and got the U-bahn and S-bahn to Schonefeld airport in about 35 minutes, dont waste money on taxis in Berlin the public transport is superb! We would go back to this hotel in an instant as it was superb value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but certainly not the worst”
Reviews.Author: AussieLawyer29
Reviews.Content: I found this place after doing a search on Trip Advisor. It's within close proximity to well known sights and shopping. I am not so sure the hotel is 4 stars but it was quite reasonable. I was driving in Berlin and it was quite difficult for my GPS to pick up the location. The room was large and clean with a separate sofa and large television. The Kind Size bed was very comfortable. The bathroom wasn't large but then again it was not tiny. It is perfect if travelling solo or with a friend. I only had one night here. We ate in the restaurant downstairs. There was very little food to select from on the menu and the wine list was minimalistic (maybe $8-12 per glass) and even then it wasn't great. Service was so - so! Germans were not so friendly unless of course you head into the centre of Berlin and do some shopping. Here you will find most European brands but quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: GlobeStomper
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Berlin is in a good location and offers good value for the money. The staff were polite, but did not necessarily go out of their way to help. Our room was clean and overall the hotel worked well for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Would probably stay here again”
Reviews.Author: MindyG1981
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, Okay location - not too close to subway though. Nothing much in surrounding area. Overall good experience at this hotel but may or may not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: koko_waki
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin was highly recommended by my brother who stayed twice at the hotel. Actually, the location and the services are very good. The breakfast is various and very good quality. The rooms are very clean & very modern, and there are a number of Arabic tv channels. The only thing I didn't like was the business room to which I was upgraded the day I arrived. An upgrade means a better place and a higher level, but for r me, the superior room is a much better choice than the business room which was not up to my expectations. To sum up, the hotel is an excellent choice for visitors of Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “The price, location, cleanliness cannot be beat!”
Reviews.Author: SMHDumbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the nice, clean, modern Hotel Berlin for two nights in early May 2011 with my Mum; we had separate rooms on the 6th floor, facing the courtyard. Both rooms were very quiet, spacious, modern and clean. The hotel itself is a 5-7 minute walk from the U Bahn station Nollendorfplatz, which is very handy, as the Berlin U/S Bahn system is excellent (cheap, clean & frequent service). Also, it’s a 15-20 minute walk to Kurfurstendam, KaDeWe and the main shopping area. If you’re a “walker” you can get to almost anywhere in Berlin from Hotel Berlin, we found it very conveniently located! The service was hit and miss, but overall good. My Mum requested a different type of pillows and duvet for the second night (allergies) and the cleaners supplied these with no fuss. The guy helping us with the internet went out of his way to help us delete our browsing history. The reception staff weren’t super friendly, but I suppose at a 700-room hotel that’s to be expected. With two notable exceptions, they were all polite and reasonably helpful. I was shocked, however, when on check out I asked whether they had deducted anything from my credit card (we had paid in advance and I had read reviews on here saying you should be vigilant) and they said no and that they would “release” the sum the had “reserved” the same day. I asked for clarification and somehow they reserve a sum on your credit card for extras etc, but they don’t ask you for permission to do that in advance. When I pointed out that asking in advance would probably be a good thing, the man in reception just stared blankly at me. I was so gobsmacked I didn’t even ask how much they had reserved. I have never before encountered this at a hotel (and I have travelled a fair bit) and found it very strange and quite discomforting. In the end, Hotel Berlin did not deduct anything from my credit card, though. They do charge you for every little extra (breakfast, internet …), but as long as you’re aware of that, I reckon it’s alright, given the price, location, cleanliness & location of the hotel. Breakfast was €21 and we just could not bring ourselves to pay that, so we brought in some brekkie and stored yoghurt in the fridge in the room. All in all, I would strongly recommend it, but I do wish they would ask before “reserving” any sums. :) Liked the most: the location and the clean rooms. Liked the least: “reserving” a sum on my credit card and not telling me!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NaomiBu
Reviews.Content: Just a 2 minute walk from the nearest U-Bahn and with a good number of restaurants and small eateries in the area, make this hotel a great base point for any stay in Berlin. Only down side is breakfast is not included in the cost of the room. To avail of Breakfast it is €21 for the buffet. So can't comment on the food at this as did not eat there. Did avail of room service on the first night, good food promptly served. Mini bar is empty in your room with all drinks and snacks available at the front desk. For me this was perfect - it meant no high mini bar costs and I could use the fridge for the drinks & snacks I bought in the local shops. Overall great rooms, friendly staff and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: focus63
Reviews.Content: Contemporary and comfortable hotel that I would recommend to anyone traveling to Berlin. The bar is modern, vibrant with multitude of colours which creates a fantastic atmosphere in the evening, yet refreshing and welcoming during the day, ideal for work or meetings. Breakfast is amazing even though it sounds pricy at first.

Reviews.Title: “Modern clean...just slightly outside city centre.”
Reviews.Author: RLJlovestravelling
Reviews.Content: Good hotel. Clean & well equipped rooms. Breakfast nice & most staff helPful & friendly bar a few receptionists. Would return to this hotel if visiting Berlin again.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant and nice, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Neko71
Reviews.Content: Title says it all. Hotel staff was courteous and the accommodations nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant”
Reviews.Author: rmdbfn
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. We stayed in a classic room which was very spacious, hotel staff were helpful, rooms were clean, secure basement parking, breakfast is substantial but is costly if you don't purchase it alongside your room booking. Hotel is in an ideal location for exploring both east and west Berlin. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: ImAlwaysOnHoliday
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because of the price. It seemed modern, recently renovated, good transport links, and most importantly... breakfast included. When we arrived, we went to our room, but it was two single beds joined together, and a bit dingy. We phoned down to reception to ask for a proper double room, and were offered the opportunity to upgrade our room for €10 euros more per night. We did this and were glas we did, since the room we then got was recently refurbed, and very nice. There is a bus station right outside the hotel, which is straight to either Alexander Platz or Zoo Gardens. The bus is really easy to use, since there is a little flashing board which tells you which station is coming up, and it is also announced. There is also a Metro station roudn the corner, so that was really convenient. The reception staff are excellent at telling you which buses to catch and where to change to help you plan out your day. Also if anyone is going for a weekend in November or December, you can buy a single ticket which will work all day on the transport system. No need for a travel card. Also, don't forget to validate tickets as there are plain clothed police officers around. So back to the hotel - breakfast was a large selection which was nice. The staff at Breakfast were a bit abrupt but I think that's just their way. Big buffet selection, you can have your eggs freshly made. There were cereals, breads, continental meats, cakes, cooked breakfast, fruits, yogurts, all different coffees and teas (e.g. lattes, hot chocolate etc). Maid service was good too. Room always looked very nice. When booking here, obviously be aware that you aren't right in the centre, so you will have to use the public transport. That said, if you don't mind being on the bus for 5-10 minutes to get somewhere, then its not a problem at all. Very reasonable hotel, for an even more reasonable price. Just make sure you get put in a newly renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Terrific Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: morfish
Reviews.Content: We arrived early (11.30am) after a long flight and our standard room wasn't ready. We were able to upgrade to a superior room for 10 euros per night and were able to access the room immediately. The room was clean, modern and attractive and included a flat-screen TV. The open plan bar in the lobby area was very nice. Dinner in the Julius Restaurant was quite good. The buffet breakfast was terrific with a very wide selection that should suit everyone. There isn't much in the immediate area of the hotel but the shopping district of Kurfurstendamm is within easy walking distance for a wide selection of shops, restaurants and bars. Also, the hop-on-hop-off tourist buses all stop across the street from the hotel, making it a very convenient location for easy access to sightseeing trips. Internet was only available free for 30 minutes per day, otherwise it cost 15 euros per 24 hours access. The only other negative was the maid failed to refil the liquid soap dispenser and the tissues. We enjoyed our stay and would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Return to an old favourite”
Reviews.Author: Tosca1962
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on a number of occasions. The hotel always seems to be evolving and has undergone quite a revamp since my last visit. There is a choice of rooms. I chose a "Classic". Rooms are fresh, clean and spacious. I particularly loved the fact that there were so many mirrors in the room....floor-to-ceiling double-fronted sliding wardrobe doors, half a wall in the bathroom and a full-length mirror by the door. Great for when you're getting ready to go out! There's a good size seating area and a desk and chair with a flat-screen TV incorporating a good choice of channels. There's also a free-standing air conditioning unit and tea/coffee making facility. The minibar, however, no longer exists as the hotel now has a "grab & go" section in reception where you can purchase drinks and snacks to take to your room. The lobby / bar area is now much brighter than before and all the staff greet you as you walk around the hotel. Check-in and check-out was simple and if you arrive too early for initial check-in (3pm) they will gladly store your bag for you if you want to go off exploring without having to lug your suitcase around with you. There is a taxi rank outside the hotel, but a majority of the sights are within easy walking distance in any direction. Taxi to/from the airport will set you back around Euro 25-35.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, quiet area but convenient bus route”
Reviews.Author: laura_blonde
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean, staff very helpful and in a nice location. One convenient and frequent bus into all the sights, but far enough away to be out of the bustle. Very much enjoyed our stay - only disadvantage was the very expensive internet. (For those of you who have iPass, it doesn't work in the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “welcoming, clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: RefreshinglyFrank
Reviews.Content: This was my second weeklong stay in Berlin Berlin and this year was much better than I rember last year. The showers were hot and strong, there was a daily fruit and water delivery, the gym was perfectly clean and well maintained. Housekeeping was a little variable day to day, but generally excellent. The front desk staff and management were helpful and the bus staff always seemed happy and helpful. I like that they have removed the standard mini-bar contents (available in the lobby) but kept the fridge in the room. I love the breakfast at this hotel, and since I am usually attending a conference, it's nice to have the ability to have a healthy and hearty meal to start the day, since I never know when I may get my next one. The location is central, but not too convenient to any one area, but in Berlin the location is always a bit of a compromise for one thing or another you might want to do.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, away from attractions...”
Reviews.Author: TheChadi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, has very pleasant staff and has modern rooms all over. Getting from the lobby to my room is like walking around the whole block, that's how big it was! It isn't something you really appreciate when you are in a hurry but I can understand that's the way it is. The hotel is no close to any attractions and the closest public transportation metro (u-bahn) is a mere 5 minutes walk from the hotel. From there you can get to just about anywhere you want within the city. Overall, the hotel is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, with client-friendly staff, nicely appointed rooms and outstanding breakfast to make your stay special”
Reviews.Author: ahermosilla
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel for both business and leisure. The staff were very friendly and made us feel at home from the beginning. Breakfast was outstanding. A good location to move about the city. Can only be recommended highly for its superb value-for-money.

Reviews.Title: “Top Hotel in Top Location with overpriced Internet”
Reviews.Author: OskarMadison
Reviews.Content: The Hotel's location is perfect. Situated across from a small park and surrounded by mostly residential buildings it is in a quite area. In front of it is a taxi stand or you can walk in 5 minutes to either subway station Nollendorfplatz or Wittenbergplatz where the famous KA DE WE shop is located. Check in was a breeze with plenty of personnel around and in less than 5 minutes we were in our spacious room We stayed in a junior suite which is spacious enough to have guests if you don't want to meet in the Hotel Bar. The sofa bed comes in handy if you travel with kids, which we did at a previous stay. The bathroom is large, well lit and separate from the toilet which, along with a hand basin, is in a separate room. Nice. The bathtub is great if you like baths, but, because of its sculpted and uneven bottom not ideal for showers. Be careful not to slip! Our only real complaint is the fact that the hotel no longer offers free internet. On our previous stay I maintained contact with my company and friends via wireless internet. This service is now only available for 15.95 Euro per day. It is coupled with some TV channel package for which I have no use, because I'm not in Berlin to seek TV entertainment. I hope they will have changed that policy before I plan my next trip to that great city because I don't want to look for another first class hotel that doesn't charge me for something that ought to be offered for free.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Business Trip of a few days”
Reviews.Author: Bul
Reviews.Content: during a business Trip I expect very simple things: good breakfast, spacious bar for talks, central location , helpfull speedy personal , a quiet room and fair price. All of these were ok except for smelly room and very high Room rate. Next Time i will try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hospitality,great service and kindness,EXCELLENT BREAKFAST!!! :-)”
Reviews.Author: fantkorakla
Reviews.Content: A hotel near to sights,basic places and easy to find!I'm satisfied,I'll be there soon again!!!Maybe in Christamas,but it's for sure!I'll never forget the elegance,hospitality,great staff and service!I strongly recommend it...

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for a city break in berlin”
Reviews.Author: RJ777
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an easyjet package, with flight and hotel included, so got a good rate for the hotel. We stayed at hotel Berlin for 6 nights. On Arrival the staff were friendly, and we were allowed to check in as 12:00 even though check in isnt usually until 15:00. The foyer was always very busy when we went through so didnt really ask the staff many questions, but on the couple of occasions we dealt with them they were pleasent and spoke english well. I cannot comment on the breakfast facilities (as we didnt book breakfast with the hotel), or the gym/sauna facilities-as I didnt use these. Location: Was about 5 mins walk away from a underground station, where you can get to all the main stations! I didnt use the busses but there is a bus stop outside too. If you dont mind a walk it wasnt far to walk from the hotel to brandenburg gate etc, that took about half an hour through the Tiergarten. There is a few restuarants around the area, a Steak restuarant and an Italian, which are withing about 10mins walk. Not that many bars though. Our room was at the back of the hotel looking over the car park so wasnt too noisy. The Room: We had a double standard room, it was very spacious with a sofa, table and 2 chairs, there was a nice bathroom and the shower was powerful. There was also a small fridge (we kept beer and orange juice in it), and a nice flatscreen TV - my only complaint would be that only ITV was working out of the UK channels, not BBC1 and BBC2, even though they show on there. The rooms were tidied daily and the coffee restocked. Overall I liked the location of the hotel even though it isnt in the most lively location - if you want to be in the midst of all the nightlife then this hotel probably isnt for you - but this wasnt a problem due to the transport links near the hotel, which were very good. I liked the room it was a good size and kept very clean.

Reviews.Title: “good location, nice room, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: arnsch
Reviews.Content: This hotel is huge ! With this comes a great level of efficiency and service. Located in walking distance to a subway station and next to a bus stop (convenient line 100 which passes by lots of sightseeing points), the hotel occupies a whole bock. It's easy to get lost in the hotel due to the size. The room as very clean, flatscreen TV, nice bathroom. Even though the room faced a buisy street, noice was okay on the 6th floor. Breakfast was very good with lots of choice, hot&warm, German rolls and fresh orange juice. Only negative point: no swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Njoytravl
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin Berlin was OK, but not one of my favorite of the 5 hotels we stayed in across Europe. It was big and impersonal, although the desk staff was helpful. The wait staff at the bar in the evenings was polite, but overly busy. The wi-fi cost money per day (sorry, can't remember how much, maybe about $10-12 American dollars per day). The rooms were OK and clean enough. About a block from the hotel there were prostitutes walking the street in the evenings.

Reviews.Title: “careful... or they'll rip you off”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan13
Reviews.Content: Okay, the hotel itself is not bad and in a good neighborhood -- close to shopping in the Western core. But, the staff is another question all together... I found the restaurant and front desk staff to be unhelpful and rude. Then, when I was checking out (at 6 a.m.) they tried to charge me for two days of internet access at 16 euros a day. I explained that I only used the internet once and after a long discussion (which started with the guy at the desk calling me a liar), they agreed to only charge me for one day's use.
