Then, of course, when I got home and checked my amex statement they had gone ahead and charged my account separately for a second day. Weasels just wanted to be rid of me but had no intent of rectifying this situation. I've heard others complain about similar things happening there.

Reviews.Title: “Good solid 4+ star hotel”
Reviews.Author: franichc
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything you would expect out of a 4 star hotel. Some of the features were worthy of a 5 star. All staff had great english and were very polite. The breakfast (although pricey) was very good. The room itself was again what you would expect out of this level of hotel. The lobby and bar area are very nice and was a nice place to sit and have a drink. The location is a little out of the centre but still close enough not to be a nuisance so I think you get a good price on the back of this. This hotel is a perfect example of a 4+ star hotel. cheers chris

Reviews.Title: “Okay Hotel, Could be better”
Reviews.Author: ruddi91
Reviews.Content: Clean, Not much value for Money thogh flexible, ZERO frills

Reviews.Title: “Great value, clean, modern, good location”
Reviews.Author: aj_sw9
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over the busy Berlin Pride (CSD) weekend. Despite a full house - they have nearly 500 rooms - the hotel never felt crowded or chaotic. The rooms were very clean and well finished. The service in the bar was a little slow, but that seemed to be common just about everywhere we went in Berlin making me think it was us, not them, who are impatient! The saunas and fitness area in the basement were immaculate. The hotel is a 4-5 minute walk from Nollendorf Platz U-Bahn and about 5-10 mins walk from the Ku'damm shopping strip. The wifi charges are a bit extreme (€15.95 for 24 hours) but you get 30 mins free to trial the service when you first log in. Oh, and the hop-on-hop-off tourist bus stops right out the front too.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: TrOm_10
Reviews.Content: Hotel was lovely and clean. Staff have excellent english and very helpful. Breakfast while expensive was excelelnt - all you can eat buffet, with great selection of food. Hotel is also near Underground and bus service. Very easy to get into central Berlin and visit tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “excellent value if you are looking for a comfortable & functional place”
Reviews.Author: steven888
Reviews.Content: Its not an exciting hotel but seriously good value for money. booked a junior suite which was fantasic considering the 110 euro price tag. everything super clean and decently decorated. staff is very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and atmosphere, a bit out of the way”
Reviews.Author: fgcheng
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Hotel Berlin Berlin. The lobby is quite modern and impressive, and the rooms are very comfortable. We needed a third bed, and they were very accommodating with this request. The bathrooms are great and the room decor pleasant. There is not much of a view from the rooms. It is located in a quieter part of the city, which could become problematic if you are walking home late at night. Otherwise, it is accessible to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SebNY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very modern in the lobby and restaurant. Our room was large and very clean. The beds were comfy also. The rooms were decorated in a 80s style in blue and rose, but it didn't bother me that much because it was clean and large and also quiet!!! The breakfast was delicious. It was a huge american -style buffet and they even had someone making made-to-order omlettes. Everyone was very friendly within the hotel as well. We would definitely reccommed this hotel and go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Large business hotel - good for business but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: ViaggiaBene
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Berlin Berlin for 4 nights with a group of collagues. It is a very large and modern business / conference hotel with good facilities, a very good breakfast, a smallish gym and great conference space. The decor is vaguely 70ish with some truly tacky and awful details, service is good but impersonal as per any other hotel of this size and rooms are good sized but with very poor room amenities (for a four stars). Hotel location is good for business, not that good for sightseeing or nightlife as it is in a mostly business, modern and soulless area of the city. It was good for us as we were on a very busy business trip but I would not stay there on leisure (especially at those prices)

Reviews.Title: “Spacious room and very friedly staff”
Reviews.Author: MJBHighWycombeBucks
Reviews.Content: The recommendations for this hotel were not misplaced. We've just returned from an excellent stay in a classic room there which was at least twice as large as any we've stayed in before.It was quiet and nicely furnished. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, for example they advised us not to buy the highly advertised Berlin Card but instead, as there four of us, to take a Klein Gruppenkarte which at e 16.10 for up to five people gives unlimited travel for a day in zones ab&c.They told us where to eat eg Wirtshaus zum Lowenstein near Zoologisches Garten Bahnhof or Zum Nussbaum, a real German Stube in the Nikolai Viertel a short walk down from Alexander Platz. They also stored our luggage safely on our final day till we had to catch the 19.41 train to the airport. Just outside the hotel there's a bus stop for the 100 which takes you to all the key places. It may be a large hotel but we rated it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, clinic like cleanliness, Friendly and helpful staff +15Euro per day for Internet sucks”
Reviews.Author: ribmate
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was awesome, Staff friendly and helpful, located close to Einstein Cafe its awesome too, train station two blocks away, cabs out front 24 hours a day, easy walk to the main shopping attractions and Wilhelm Church, Foosball table in lobby, Bar quiet and calm, gym top notch, Rooms are small (typical euro) but extremely adequate, $18E cab from Airport, $8E to Sony center and Berlin wall - seriously I with 25 plus years hospitality and hotel management experience thought it was one of my better hotel stays. Only downside was 15Euro a day for internet - there were Computers in lobby and you could pay to use them.

Reviews.Title: “A very comforable and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: London_Dirk
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a short break at the Berlin Berlin. The hotel is located a short distance from the U-Bahn at Nollendorf Platz and there is a No100 bus that takes into the town centre and all the sights. The staff were all very friendly and spoke perfect English. Our room was larger than expected and had English TV. The breakfast was superb and catered for all tastes. I would not hesitate in booking this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a Berlin, Berlin experience”
Reviews.Author: yaph02
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin, Berlin has a good location - with the metro station a 5 minute walk and a bus service 100 connecting you to the main attraction sites such as Unten den Linden, the Brandenburg Gate, Reichstag several 100m away from its' main entrance. While walking to the metro station, you come across many restaurants, cafes as well as supermarkets which is pretty neat as well. My partner and I had an early flight and arrived early, and the staff was willing to check us in early with no hassle. Staff service was always professional and efficient here! My only complaint would be that breakfast - at 19 euros - was rather costly.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable break in pleasant square”
Reviews.Author: johnrath
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed a comfortable stay here and also benefited from a good rate I obtained. The hotel is in a pleasant location, perhaps 20 minutes walk from Zoo station, but as I found out later in a heavy rainstorm, links directly by bus with Unter den Linden and other useful destinations. My twin musts of gym and internet access were met OK, although internet was on the expensive side. There's quite a classy bar nearby in Lutzowplatz, again slightly expensive, but cheaper places can be found in the direction of the Zoo and Ku'damm. (I can manage a 2-litre glass of beer fairly comfortably and economically!) TheEnglish TV channels were appreciated after I had experienced a day full of culture, physical effort, and eating and drinking. The staff were friendly and spoke excellent English, but things could get very hectic in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: Suegozza
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend of sightseeing and Christmas markets. The hotel is in a good location and not far from the U bahn. The hotel is huge but there were plenty of staff on reception so checking in and out was fairly quick. The room was very comfortable with tea and coffee making facilities Our only word of warning about this hotel would be about the bar prices! Overall very good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Not the ideal honeymoon choice!”
Reviews.Author: Evil_villain
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I chose this hotel as a "minimoon" destination, choosing to postpone our proper honeymoon until the summer. The room we had cost £280 for 4 nights and the rating given online was 4* plus. We thought we were getting a fabulous deal! The hotel lobby is decorated in what I would call "70s chic" but to me it was very tacky! The room was the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in and although we booked a double room we had 2 single beds pushed together. There was no safe in the room, no minibar, no complimentary toiletries and although the hotel literature said they had a linen service every other day the bed linen was not changed in our room the whole time we were there! Also the hotel corridors stank of stale smoke and we had problems sleeping because there were pigeons nesting on our balcony! That said, the location of the hotel is amazing! It was very near one of the biggest Christmas markets and within walking distance to all the major sites, transport links and the tourist bus stops right outside! Also the buffet breakfast was absolutely fantastic with a large selection of tastes catered for. The staff in the hotel were among the friendliest and most helpful I have ever come across and had the rooms been to a better standard this would have been a fantastic hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good location but cheap services in-room”
Reviews.Author: darthone
Reviews.Content: Hotel is pretty well located, a taxi station stands near the hotel and you can reach the U2 subway line in 5 min. I stayed 3 nights for business from nov 19th to nov 22th 2009 in a superior room and unfortunaltely we got a lot of troubles : > Shower was broken alternatively cold and hot every 10 seconds > 95% of the french TV channels were freezing all the time > Room window was stuck, it was impossible to open it and get fresh air (problem was fixed during day 2) > Internet Wi-Fi Access was broken since day 2 and never fixed up We asked twice for a room change or a discount without any success. I hope these remarks will help improving the quality of service Cheers Jonathan

Reviews.Title: “Good, but...”
Reviews.Author: love2travelDallas_TX
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice, however the location could be better. There aren't a lot of places directly around the hotel to eat/drink. However, the rooms were clean and large. It is a very busy hotel - lots of conventions etc. going on. The breakfast buffet is incredibly expensive, which is odd, as in Europe breakfast is usually included.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Front Desk, Uncomfortable Beds”
Reviews.Author: mrsmaryallen
Reviews.Content: After travelling all day with a 1.5 year old, we arrived at the Hotel Berlin. It is a funky hotel - lets just saw if there was a flamingo roaming around, it wouldnt be out of place. We went to the front desk at 11:30am and asked to check in early. The woman assisting us turned to a man (manager?) and asked in German if we could check in early as there were rooms available. He said 'no - I already let a few other people check in early and these people should check in on time.' They obviously didnt think that we could understand and they would not budge. We finally offered to pay an extra night or upgrade the room because the thought of spending 4 hours more with our daughter and no where to decompress was too much to imagine! Our 'upgraded room' was small but I expected it would be since we were in Europe. The problem was there was no storage space or drawers. We had a bunch of bags since we were working for 1 week and vacationing for a week and a half afterward. The beds were two twin beds pushed together. Again, I expected this but the beds kept splitting apart. Finally, I was with a group that got free breakfast. I registered through a different system but was with the same group that rented hundreds of rooms for a week. When I asked about possibly having them remove my breakfast charges given that I was with the group, they said no. I understand I registered through a different system, but clearly it wouldnt have been a big deal since they were letting people in free all week just for wearing the company shirt or being with someone wearing a company shirt. I do want to note that the breakfast was great. Not sure it was worth 19 Euros, but it may have been :) If this were 100E a night and included breakfast, then it would be worth it. Otherwise, I'd recommend staying closer to the Zoologicher Garten as that was a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, the worst Internet Connection!”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaJuanSe
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good overall! Being a four star, I consider it quite good for its price and the spacious rooms they offer. I's say its location is extremely convenient (Bus 100 across the park in fron of the hotel, which takes you everywhere), very nice room features, international standards, good variety of TV options, Spa and Gym, Sauna, Good restaurant, delicious breakfast (though not included in the rate), EXCELLET FOR CONGRESS or business trips, BUT... The room's intenet connection is a total shame! Since I spent most of the time at a congress at the Intercontinental Hotel nearby, I only used the internet connection a few times at night. The first days, I didn't bother trying it, since it didn't work properly (very poor signal in the room). Unfortunately, the last night I stayed there, when I really needed the Internet to work, it's signal was almost none. I had to work in the small hallway in front of the elevators (there's a sofa there) but it was very uncomfortable. Their staff didn't help at all and told me I had to wait till next morning. The only good thing was they didn't charge for it (Obviously!) but if you need internet, check before going if this issue has been solved! Otherwise, great location and value for its rates!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: spanougakis
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended, very close to the city center, next to metro and bus station. Free wireless internet in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Phenomenal Service”
Reviews.Author: Souperher0
Reviews.Content: This hostel was excellent. The location is just off the train, so it's easy to get around. Moreover, there are plenty of great bakeries and a grocery store nearby. The neighborhood, while not great, isn't bad. The hotel itself was wonderful. We stayed in a private room, and it was large and clean. The staff was the best, though. They were always helpful and answered any of our questions. More than that, they helped us with a map and information upon arrival, knew taxi amounts, etc. It was the best place for service--like in house travel agents. Breakfast was great and hotel has internet.

Reviews.Title: “Great introduction to Berlin for the first time”
Reviews.Author: Venezia41
Reviews.Content: I apologise for my late comments re my stay at the Hotel Berlin, Berlin for 3 nights, 29 to 31 January this year, due to my whole life changing after being retrenched when I returned to work after my vacation. Hotel Berlin is situated in an easily accessible area about one-third the bus journey to/ from Bahnhof Zoologischer/Alexanderplatz. It is a large hotel, surrounding a ‘block’ with a very large “internal open area” for a ‘Winter Garden” and various other administrative and/or functional sections of the hotel. I was allocated an upper floor room overlooking that area’, which provided lots of day light, most needed in February. The room was large and well decorated with a lounge area plus a ‘huge’ closet, minibar and the usual 4-star hotel inclusions. My dinner in the hotel for the first two nights was excellent and a very personable maitre‘d assisted me re wine selection. The buffet breakfast (incl. in the room rate) was “stunning” and consisted of a wide range of juices, cereals, fruits, breads, cold selections (meats and cheeses) as well as hot, i.e. scrambled egg, bacon, tomatoes, etc. The selection of ‘anything and everything’ was amazing. I loved every ‘mouth-watering’ moment! My last night at Hotel Berlin, I ate at an Italian Restaurant, “Sorriso Ristorante”, close by the hotel at 76 Kurfurstenstrasse, which was perfect and made even more so by a delightful waiter. The restaurant is a very comfortable, atmospheric Italian gastronomical experience. I loved every mouthful of my main course of Vitello Romani followed by “Dolci” with my waiter suggesting I have ‘half & half’ of my two favourite sweets. My whole meal was a ‘magical” experience and one I will never forget. I recommend this hotel in relation to its very helpful staff, its access to good transport connections, i.e. bus to/from the airport and proximity to Zoologischer Bahnhoff for S and U Bahn as well as Charlottenburg, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Nice updated hotel near the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: martyoz
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean and modern. The hotel provides a full array of amenities and would be a great business hotel, though we were on a pleasure trip. They had a nice gym setup. The only drawback was the small lobby, which was jammed with business conference attendees the days we were there. We were located only 2 blocks or so from a metro stop, so getting around was a breeze. The opposite direction the Tiergarten is a 15 minute walk, and a variety of dining opportunities were available within a 6 block walk to the west. Not much happening in the immediate surrounding blocks, but it appeared construction is underway on some new businesses. We got a breakfast buffet with the room rate. It was a great value! One shortcoming was the "American breakfast," advertised as including scrambled eggs and sausage. In fact, the "scrambled eggs" were a custard-like concoction and the ground sausage tasted like saute'd liverwurst. Still, the German and Continental offerings were great, and the breakfast added a lot of value to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: taylorjames
Reviews.Content: Anyone who wants to spoil themselves without breaking the bank, should stay in Hotel Berlin. Myself and my wife stayed here for three days in September 2009 and were bowled over by the huge, spotless room, the great food and the price. The staff care centre caters for your every need and all staff were friendly and helpful, and you are a two minute walk away from bus stops that will bring you to all parts of this great city. The rooms have air conditioning, are soundproofed and the beds are extremely comfortable. This was the first hotel built in Berlin after the end of the second world war and has been totally renovated to fully deserve its four star rating. We will visit Berlin again and will definitely stay in this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Berlin - Not for anyone over 40”
Reviews.Author: jujuberry
Reviews.Content: Stayed here several years ago. At the time an older, cosy, friendly hotel with a pub and reasonably priced food and drink. Since then the old hotel has been apparently torn down and replaced with a 'faux chic' design. Rooms are large and well appointed. No central heating or cooling. The halls are oppressively warm. Bathroom fittings are already falling apart (cheap), carpet stained, etc. Staff are just this side of surly. Average guest age appears to be thirty or less. If you are not German, expect to be treated less than cordially. Restaurant is extremely expensive with limited choices. Staff are not friendly. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant hotel- couldn't have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: LeicesterLouise
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to berlin as a pre-christmas break, as we had been told that the markets were some of the best in europe. We chose this hotel on a whim as it was the cheapest, and we agreed that we didn't mind roughing it! However, our room was absolutely huge and the bathroom was a good size as well. I have already recommended this hotel to my parents, who are going to book this hotel for their christmas break this year. All of the staff are really friendly and when I came back in a fit of excitement becuase he had just proposed they offered us a celebratory drink on the house! I really don't have a bad word to say about this hotel. Even the bar prices were quite reasonable (especially when compared to our capital city!) Definately stay here, its a bargain and central to everything (took us 10+ mins to walk to all the tourist attractions) also, the local taxis are SO cheap so if you don't want to walk step outside the hotel and there is a taxi rank right outside.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel - good base.”
Reviews.Author: Gill46Aberdeen
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in July. We had read reviews saying reception staff weren't always very friendly and, although we woudn't entirely agree with this, they definately didn't go out of there way to do more than they had to But, they helped us where we needed it and were always efficient. The bar and waiting staff, however, couldn't have been nicer. The hotel itself is within a reasonable 10 or 15 minute walk of most things and we found it to be a good base. The hotel has some amazing design features inside, and was very young and modern. Rooms were big enough (although there only seem to be twin beds, and not doubles) and the buffet breakfast is great and kept us going all day. The gym was particulary good and modern for a hotel gym. Overall, I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again if we were in Berlin in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be coming back!”
Reviews.Author: ingeborgv
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a six night stay at Hotel Berlin, Berlin. Nice location in a not too busy neighborhood, within walking distance both to Potsdamer Platz/Brandenburger Tor and the sights of West Berlin (KaDeWe, Kurfurstendamm etc.) Nice, large room which the staff kept spotless throughout our stay. Friendly, English speaking staff, good drinks in the lobby bar (though pricier than most of Germany). Great deals on rooms during off-season. We'll be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with good location”
Reviews.Author: EBlakstad
Reviews.Content: A large hotel with a good atmosphere, mixed business and leisure. Nice room. Great breakfast with a large variety. Large and nice fitness center and spa. Bus stop within 100 meters and U-bahn within 12 minutes. Walking distance to the shopping street Kurfurstendam. Outdoor parking somewhat expensive: 20 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Funkmasterflex
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel at a bargain price on expedia. Was a bit aprehensive about what it would be like because I got such a good deal. The hotel was fantastic, room was spacious, very clean and like a previous reviewer said its 20 minuetes walk from all the top attractions, It couldnt be in a more central and better location. Try the cocktail lounge Bar am Lutzowplatz a minutes walk from the hotel entrance they do a brilliant "watermellon Man" voted Berlins best cocktail bar twice

Reviews.Title: “Just what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Gerasimo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here early December 2007 with my wife for 4 weekday nights. It was better than I expected. Our room was a good size with a mini bar and a lounge area. It was cleaned every day. The breakfast was a buffet, and it was excellent. Really set me up for the damp cold sightseeing I was about to do. The bar was very friendly, and the staff would always bid us to sit down whilst they brought our drinks to us. We ate in the restaurant once, and the food was really good. I had a steak, cooked to my exact specification. The restaurant price was a bit steep though. The restaurant manageress was really nice, and took good care of us. The location for us was good too. We meant to do some walking, and I completed an ambition, to walk through Tiergarten, down Strasse des 17 Juni and on to the Brandenburg Gate and on to Unter den Linden, taking in the Russian Memorial and the Reichstag. There were some nice restaurants local to the hotel. Just round the corner, there is a lovely Italian restaurant, and I swear I bumped into Gerhard Shroeder in there. He does live in Berlin I'm told. There was a good chinese nearby too. The U-Bahn was only five minutes from the hotel. If you go to Berlin, then get yourself a 72 hour pass for the transport network. You can use the U-Bahn, S-Bahn and buses for 72 hours once you have validated the ticket. I think there are two levels, one for the city centre and one that takes in all of Berlin and Potsdam too. Potsdam definetly worth a visit. If you fly into Schönefeld, the taxi into Berlin can be expensive. The train is much cheaper and very easy to use. The train does a big curved route through parts of the old East Germany. It was an interesting trip. The main stop is Alexanderplatz. Once in Berlin centre, you can easily get an U-Bahn close to most places or just get a local taxi. We visited Charlottenberg Palace, near Spandau. It's a piece of renovation, but really well done. All the artefacts have been gathered from other palaces that were destroyed beyond renovation in 1945. In early December, they have a good Christmas Market outside the main gates. Hotel Berlin was a good choice for us, and if the manager is reading this, then a freebie would be very much appreciated. I have no problem recommending this hotel to anyone. The price for us was good too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a very rich breakfast i”
Reviews.Author: Persefon
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is situated in a good location but by foot it takes too time to go to the main sights, I suggest the taxi for you transportation. The Hotel is very big (one block!) . The rooms are very clean and the bathroom is spacious, but they DON'T have DOUBLE beds, so I don't suggest it if you are a couple. It's main advantage is his rich breakfast buffet with fruits, cakes, croissants,eggs, wurstel etc.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel bad front desk”
Reviews.Author: jimmythefish_9
Reviews.Content: we booked the hotel through booking.com and specifically asked for a double bed plus there was an offer for a larger room about 40sq.m When we arrived we got a room with two twin beds and a normal room. once we complained the front desk manager insisted that we were wrong and were very rude to us. once they found out the mistake was theirs they never changed us room or even give us a compensation. the front desk people continued to be rude all through our stay and very unhelpful.

Reviews.Title: “A good bet at any price, a great deal if under $100 USD”
Reviews.Author: jgb10011
Reviews.Content: b Berlin, Berlin is a very large business hotel (700+ rooms) that appears to cater to large higher end tour groups and business meetings. With the exception a swimming pool, the hotel offers all the amenities one would expect for such a large modern hotel. The standard rooms were HUGE not just by European standards, but by any standard. The classic double included two twin beds moved together to form a queen size space (typical practice in Germany) with new higher end linens, nights stands, separate sitting area with full sofa, coffee table, and sitting chairs, a desk and chair, small flat panel TV with BBC and CNN available, and FREE WiFi throughout the hotel (a rare and valuable amenity in large business class hotels). A very large closet with wide full length mirrored doors was opposite the ample size full bath. The front desk was staffed by friendly, always helpful professionals all of whom spoke flawless English (other language-speaking staff were also available) and adjacent to the front desk was a 24 hour "grab and go" snack cooler with tasty sandwiches, chicken wraps, and beverages available for purchase at a fair price 24 hours a day. The oversized lobbies included a bar which also offered food most of the day. A full restaurant serving food at three mealtimes is also available. (I only ate breakfast there once and will comment on that later, so I cannot evaluate the quality or value of other meals.) An impressive (for a hotel) modern gym was available 24x7 free of charge for guests in the lower level. Also in the lower level was an outoor/indoor relaxation lounge with its own tranquility waterfall, and two dry saunas which were operational from about 6 to 10PM and during other hours by request. Local phone calls were fairly priced at about 0.8 Euros. The location was perfect for me as I like to walk and be central to everything but not right in the middle of anything. In 15-20 minutes I could walk to the heart of the K'damm, the middle of Tiergarten, the zoo and aquarium, and the Shoneberg nightlife - in perhaps 20-30 minutes be at the Reichstag and Brandenberg gate. U-bahn and S-bahn stations are a good 10-15 minute walk. That said, those who want to have a plethora of restaurant choices and tourist attractions just outside the door might be disappointed in what I have read elsewhere has been described as a rather "bland" location. My ONLY criticism of the hotel and my stay there is the very expensive price (19 Euros / $28 USD) for the breakfast buffet. Yes, it was plentiful and presented a variety of hot and cold selections, but the level of pricing is more appropriate for a full scale Sunday brunch, not a breakfast. Fortunately, there are other choices nearby. (E.g., the nearby Holiday Inn Express even advertises outside its door "Paying too much for breakfast at your hotel? Enjoy ours for 7.95 Euros." Granted it offered only a simple cold buffet, but for 11 Euros difference, it was fine. Simple coffee, juice, and bread breakfasts were available elsewhere nearby for about 4 to 5 Euros. This hotel is a GREAT VALUE if you can get a room at a good rate $90 USD or less, and a little more if breakfast is include, and a fair value in the $100-$120 range. Once the rooms sell for over $130 you probably can find better values elsewhere. But at any price, unless you're expecting Ritz Carlton luxury, the Hotel Berlin, Berlin is a good bet.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay in the heart of Berlin”
Reviews.Author: whylee
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was fantastic, the rooms were a decent size and very comfortable. I would recommend staying at this hotel whilst in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: BostonTraveler62
Reviews.Content: My superior double room was modern, spacious, and very well-equipped. Hairdryer, iron, refrigerator, A/C, Free Wi-Fi, big European tub plus shower. Hot water, tea and cream in the room but bring your own instant coffee! I stayed there more than once and only one room had a safe. Rooms faced the inner courtyard and were very quiet. Only negatives were the very long walk from reception to the rooms and having to change elevators to get to the sixth floor. Also the breakfast is not included and I found it ridiculously expensive at EU 20 per person. Convenient parking, pay lot and underground garage right there, EU 20 per day. I found the service so-so, lots of very young people at the desk and they are not very customer-friendly. But I paid about EU 80 per night and think this is a great value for a really nice room and a good location (although you have to take a bus to the U-Bahn Zoo Station.) Very convenient if you are driving though. Short walk to Kurfurstendamm. Lots of cafes and restaurants around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and functional”
Reviews.Author: Auldbuff
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife for a week. Booked 'Standard' rooms through third party agency to cut costs. Room was very spacious and clean.Staff on the reception were efficient. Although this is a 700 room hotel we heard very little noise from other guests. Would certainly stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: EazyK
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with nice and clean rooms. Good beds and a clean, large bathing room. The metro station to all good places in Berlin is at a 5 minute walk. Very good price/quality, but a disadvantage is that you have to pay for all extras. For instance, razor blades are not included in the price but will cost you more. We had a small discussion with the staff during our stay (about paying for the breakfast), but this was solved to our satisfaction.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Horrible Customer Service and overcharges left and right”
Reviews.Author: motormachine
Reviews.Content: i stayed here for 8 days. the junior suite was perfect for my needs. i used the free WIFI which was slow, but was nice to have. the gym is nice and clean. after checking out and getting home, they started billing my credit card for things i didnt order and also charged me 120 euros for the 64k free WIFI. ive been trying to get them to correct the mistake, but they have been very stubborn and refused. i would recommend not giving them a credit card, or else you will find mystery charges after checking out. ive heard this from others online as well, and for this reason will not be returned here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Pebrighton
Reviews.Content: I liked the hotel but I found a number of issues frustrating. Reception staff were rude and unhelpful. They had a real attitude about them. The lifts didn't link to all floors. Breakfast very expensive. And the location not good - close to no-where. The free wi - fi was down over the weekend we stayed. Way too many TV channels - in the hundreds, it was silly. Oh and taxi drivers outside woudn't always take you if you weren't going to the airport. The rooms though were excellent, clean and nice. Hotel was funky but very much for the conference trade. I wouldn't recommend due to the rude reception staff. Shame othewise it would have been worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at this hotel. The man who first helped us at front desk, unfortunately I can't remember his name, was so polite and funny! He made us feel so welcome from our first minute. The rooms are good, normal size with a nice big bed. The pillows are those square flat ones that some European hotels have and are a bit uncomfortable however I requested two extra pillows and they brought them straight up to our room and the problem was solved. They supplied us with a map and marked out all the main spots to see which was great. The service at the bar is fantastic and it is lovely to sit out in the courtyard in the sun enjoying a nice cold beer. I would definitely recommend this hotel and if we return to Berlin i will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “funky”
Reviews.Author: jaimie_es
Reviews.Content: Hotel Berlin, Berlin – funky Huge 700 room hotel, recently renovated, a short hop to the Ku’damm and within reasonable walking distance to the Potsdammerplatz. For those too lazy to walk, Wittenberg and Nollendorfplatz underground train stations are almost around the corner, while taxis are available right opposite the main entrance to the building. There is also a car park at the back of the property. We got a superior room, very funky. Spacious, bright and airy. Comfortable beds. Shame the pillows were so miserably flat. In room facilities included tea & coffee making facilities, and HDTV with an endless list of national and international channels, plus a wide range of music and games. The bathroom was small but well appointed. No fancy toiletries, though, just soap dispensers, rather disappointingly for a 4 star hotel. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There was everything we could ever wish for, and more. Top quality. Lovely carrot cake. For those into healthier diets, lots and lots of fruit. Mind you, in such a big hotel, you will need to get up early in the morning if you want to have your breakfast in peace and quiet, or be prepared to have a busy, noisy start to your day. Would we return? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tilz1
Reviews.Content: Stayed on Business, was perfectly fine for 4 nights, the hotel is big and clean. I had a room off the road which I guess helps, the gym is nice and modern mostly machines and only a few free weights. Can walk to the Europa Center etc in about 10 mins so good location for shopping, located only 5 or so stops from the ICC aswell if you are working there. U station is about 5/10 mins walk away so overall a good hotel

Reviews.Title: “Huge, clean, modern and nice”
Reviews.Author: Ale_ita_83
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very big, the rooms are definitely comfy and absolutely clean. A professional staff is ready to welcome you. Me and my partner had booked a double room and actually found two separate beds, so if you'd like to have a queen bed make sure you clarify that before reserving. The price didn't include any meal but it was reasonable. The (buffet) breakfast they serve is awesome but expensive (19 euros per person, if that's not included in your package and you want to give it a try). Convenient location, at a 5 minute walking distance from the nearest subway stop.

Reviews.Title: “you will not be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: heiny90
Reviews.Content: I was taking my family to a good area of Berlin in Januar so we picked this area. I wanted to show the childs the sights of Berlin and we also wanted to go shopping. I'd never been to Berlin but we wanted to use the Kurfurstendamm. This is within walking distance. The price was good for the room and the staff was more than friendly. Just a shame about the weather. snow is fine for a while until the whole family has been walking around in it for two days!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Markets”
Reviews.Author: Petherbridge
Reviews.Content: My partner and I went here for a romantic weekend away for the Christmas Markets. We arrived at the hotel and was welcomed with friendly staff and the hotel done up all Christmassy. We checked in quickly and went straight up to the room, it was big modern and clean. The hotel itself was big and spacious and the staff all throughout was so friendly and helpful. The bar was so relaxing and a place we sent many hours in the evening chilling out. The drinks were a bit expensive but that’s what you will pay for drinking in a bar. We ate in the restaurant which again wasn’t that expensive and the food was lovely. The hotel was close to all the markets it was a case of getting one bus which takes 10 minutes to get takes you pass all the Christmas Markets (which we were blown away by) The hotel is right bang in the middle of all the places you need to visit while in Berlin. The public transport out in Berlin is just excellent. I can not express how much I loved this hotel and Berlin and its people but I will say it is the best hotel I have ever been too and would defiantly come back here again when we come back next Christmas.

Reviews.Title: “A great city hotel at an amazing price”
Reviews.Author: RebekahB
Reviews.Content: The hotel was part of a bargain buy from Travelzoo for a 4 night package with flights. Some of the previous reviews were mixed, especially about the location and size of rooms and the hotel's love affair with conferences. Actually, the hotel is in a decent location, 15 minutes from the Zoological Gardens on foot and 5 minutes from a very central and convenient tube station (the city is massive, so location is really by the by). The room we had was a neutral but modern mini suite with everything I'd expect from a 4*. In fact, it was a really good standard. There were a couple of conferences on but our treatment wasn't marginalised by it at all. In fact, the bar was great for people watching on those evenings. The staff were courteous, spoke great English and gave us a late checkout. My only gripe was that we were only given one teabag or cappuccino sachet between us which seems a little stingy. For everything else, if you get a good deal, go for it. This is a decent hotel by anyone's standards. Oh and Berlin is the most incredible city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: EdyeGold
Reviews.Content: I have a weekend trip with my daughter to Berlin. The hotel is really big, with a nice lobby and the check in was very efficient . The room and the bathroom extremely clean and very confortable , and new flat TV. No noise from outside . Especial attention to the breakfast, is one of the best I have ever had. All that you can imagin is there. Location is really good, there is a bus number 100, stops in front of the hotel that goes to the most important points of view. You have to buy a daily ABC ticket for euros 6.20 and you can go up and down all the times you want from buses, underground and trains. Berlin is a very nice city.

Reviews.Title: “Not Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Qtcups
Reviews.Content: Our flight from Toronto arrived in Berlin approx. 9:30 AM and we got to the hotel a little after 10:00 AM. We were told that we couldn't check in until after 3:00 PM--which wasn't the problem--but we felt that the hotel could have offered us complimentary refreshments of some sort since we had been travelling for 17 hours. All they offered us was a place to store our luggage while we walked the streets of Berlin for 5 hours until our room was ready. The room we got was OK except for the fact that the answering system on the phone did not work. We only found that out after we realized friends had attempted to make plans with us by leaving us a voicemail message that we didn't realize was waiting for us on our phone. The hotel apparantly was experiencing phone problems that they didn't bother to let us know about. Also, what irritated me the most about Hotel Berlin was the fact that there was always a business conference taking place in the hotel. The lobby constantly had a large flow of people and lots of commotion going on. The hotel is mid-level at best in terms of accommodation and ambience.

Reviews.Title: “A refreshing change”
Reviews.Author: Mohikaner
Reviews.Content: After a slew of samey samey hotels Hotel Berlin offers a change in pace and character. First impressions? The bold colour and quirky furnishings are visually refreshing and the service is great. Breakfast time was a bit of a challenge - October seems to be a time popular for conferences ~ between 8 and 9 the buffet area was a bit daunting with the masses slamming food before meetings start. Still, the conference facilities are excellent, free WIFI available all over with decent speeds. Use Ubahn stations nearby (Nollendorfplatz is slightly nearer than Wittembergplatz) for easy city access, with very frequent trains. Supermarkets, bars, restaurants all within walking distance as well as the Siegessäule, zoo and KaDeWe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: KnowlesGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights with my partner on our first trip to Berlin. The staff were very friendly and spoke English. We booked via lastminute.com and got a really good deal. The location is excellent, just 5 mins down the road from a main train station which is great to catch a train to anywhere in the city and the area itself has loads of cool cafes and bars. We stayed in a Classic room which was cosy and big. We were surprised that instead of a double bed, we had 2 single beds pushed together however we enquired about this and were told that was normal (?!). It didn't dampen the stay as the beds and big duvets and pillows were really comfy. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but we did sample the bar (open till 2) and that was really nice. Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average”
Reviews.Author: Ben-Michelle
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reading many reviews on TA and finding a good rate on expedia. Overall the hotel is good - above average in the circa 50GBP a night bracket, my wife and I stayed for four nights in Sept. Location - The hotel is located in west berlin, there is a u-bahn station about 5 mins walk away, which has direct access to Alexanderplatz in about 15 mins. The location is the problem with this hotel as the majority of the tourist attractions are in east berlin/mitte. However, access isn't so bad and you are close to KaWeDe, berlin zoo and the Tiergarten. For a prime location go for the Hilton, Adlon or Westin Grand. Hotel - The hotel has a fairly busy roads on two sides, although within the hotel you didn't notice the noise. First impression are very good, bright, airy, marble floors, uniformed staff etc. this is a smart hotel, the reception staff all spoke english and check-in was a breeze. We had booked a superior room which was very nice, a good size, nice bathroom with tub and shower, bed was a little on the firm side, but like the rest of the hotel is was spotless and looked as if it had been recently refurbished. Whilst staying there we noticed several aircrews checking in, which is normally a good sign. Overall the hotel is good quality and is fine for a long weekend/short break if you are happy being slightly away from the centre. Tip - There is an resturant / bar a few mins walk from the hotel called the 1885 restaurant - ask reception for directions. The resturant owner speaks good english, and the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: fistuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Berlin for 6 nights from August 8th. We had an excellent last minute package deal (flight and accommodation) and we picked the hotel out of 30 other choices based on Tripadvisor reviews, which we found very usefull. We arrived to the hotel in the early morning hours, and stowed our luggage in the storage room until 3 PM when we checked in. From our experience we recommend to referesh and change clothes in the spacious and clean WC near the reception before leaving the hotel. We had more than 7 hours before check in. We got a room on the 5th. floor facing the hotel inwards, preferably because we usually sleep with open windows. The room was very large and clean. The beds including the roll-away couch which my daughter slept on where comfortable. In the room was a seperate air conditioning unit which we found not so covenient (most of the hotel rooms are equipped with a built-in unit), but it was mobile so we oriented it to throw air aside. Breakfast is really suberb, highly rich buffet, everything is fresh and tasty, try to avoid the rush hour of 0800-0830 AM. The hotel is very clean in the room and in all the public areas. The staff is very helpfull, although not so cordial. Location is excellent, you can walk to the central places, or take bus # 100 which is very frequent. The only issue we had was ironing, that is not available in the room and there are no ironing facilities except in charge service.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars? Maybe 3”
Reviews.Author: Bowral
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Berlin twice, once at the beginning of a tour and again at the end of the tour. The room we had on the first occasion was roomy, clean and quite comfortable. The room we were given on our return was so small that we were unable to open our suitcases unless we put one on the bed. Whilst the room was clean and had a small balcony, it was too small to be comfortable and we were glad that we were only staying 2 nights. There is a restaurant (which didn't seem to be open when we were there) and a bar/cafe where meals can be ordered and eaten in the open courtyard. Breakfast was good with an excellent range of food which should please just about everyone. The hotel is located close to the main shopping area (Kurfurstendamm) and a pleasant walk through the Tiergarten to the Brandenburg Gate and Unter Den Linden. I would happily stay at the hotel again but would ensure that we had a larger room. I question whether it is really a 4 star hotel taking into account other 4 star hotels I have used in Europe.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: christinecatherine
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and the hotel offered us great value for money. Location is great, very central and a metro station is close by, rooms were spacious and nicely decorated and staff friendly. Would definately stay here again if visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location”
Reviews.Author: UKChris82
Reviews.Content: Whilst the hotel boasts all the usual facilities (minus a pool) that you'd expect from a hotel of this standard, the location is poor for what is described as a centrally located hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: atleti73
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend to Berlin to celebrate my birthday. We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and I must say the hotel is really nice, the room we stayed was big and comfortable and the service staff were quite friendly. This is a large hotel but you really feel looked after. The bar has a nice atmosphere, shame the rain spoilt my beer in the garden....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: fireman999
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location, price and comments by other travellers and was not disappointed in any way. My wife and I were due to stay there earlier in the year but had to cancel on the day due to our flight being cancelled. I had expected to be charged for at least one night but the very professional reservations staff understood the situation and issued a cancellation number without any financial penalty. We have recently returned from our 5 day trip and without any doubt this was one of the best run hotels that we have ever stayed in - all of the staff without exception were very professional, polite and understanding. The room and public areas were very well maintained, clean and comfortable. The food was wonderful with plenty of choice and very well presented. Anyone that has read my previous reviews will note that I always inspect the fire safety precautions when I visit hotels and I am pleased to say that these were all of the highest standard and I certainly had no worries here and would recommend it to anyone. When we returned home I even had an email hoping that I had enjoyed my break and had returned home safely. Many hotels, particularly in the UK, could learn a lot from this hotel and for those visitors that have not yet visited Berlin I can also recommend the city which is extremely interesting, safe and pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Potto22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in July. The hotel was spotlessly clean throughout. The reception, bar and restaurant staff all appeared to speak very good English, much better than London hotels I have recently stayed in. Our room was large with a balcony, overlooking other parts of the hotel. We were not asked if we wanted a non smoking room and consequently there was a smell of smoke in the room. We didn’t notice any noise from with in or outside the hotel. The hotel is well placed in the centre of Berlin only minutes walk from the Tiergarten. We arrived at Tegel Airport on a Friday afternoon, traffic was very heavy but the taxi fare was still less then 20 Euros. Because time was short we ate in the hotel restaurant both evenings. The meals including wine were expensive but good quality and the service was excellent. Bar food was also available. There was an extensive choice of good quality food available at breakfast. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Alen_T
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel near Tiergarten, good location. I expected more modern rooms. Breakfast was great!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrendanB
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with the Hotel Berlin. My wife, daughter and I stayed in what the call a "classic" room ie the smallest size but at 30 square metres it was excellent, There was loads of room and it was very clean with loads of storage space. The lobby, check in and bar are excellent with first class check in. My only complaint was that there was no safe in the room although I had no reason to be concerned. The location is excellent 15mins walk to the Sony Centre whcih we used as a focal point and 10mins to the shopping area. The main tourist sights and shopping areas are in different directions. Berlin itself was great and I would recommend it for a city break - we were there 3 nights and I was sorry we didnt book a day or two longer. We got a taxi from Scohodale airport it was handy and cost 35 euro. There is an excellent resturant outside the hotel (200 m to the right opposite the green) its expensive a meal for 3 with 2 half crafts of wine 180 euro but the food was excellent. The Sony centre has a selection of 4/5 resturants the Ozzie one is the best and do try the kanagroo steak. And do take a bus tour its a great way to get your bearings of the city and main sites So if you booked this hotel you will be pleased

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great City”
Reviews.Author: Nickyahill
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a 4 day break in Berlin and am buzzing with the delights of the city. The hotel was better than expected, i used trip advisor to choose so had read reviews but you can never be too sure, it was very business like but still leisure tourist friendly. The room was very clean and comfortable and it's location was central to all the main parts of Berlin as the public transport system is second to none. Buy an all day ticket for 6E 20. and travel anywhere in Berlin all day, the buses are every 2 mins right across the street from the hotel. We didn't try the restaurant in the hotel so can't comment on the food other that a quick snack from room service one night which was very nice. Berlin itself is facinating i totally recommend The Insider walking tour which is run by English tour guides, we would return just to take another of their tours.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for a great rate!”
Reviews.Author: JeppePaBerget
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the great city of Berlin, me and my mates stayed for 3 nights at Hotel Berlin, Berlin. At first the hotel makes a great first impression with a nice looking lobby and bar, pleasant and efficient staff, when you get to the rooms though you do get a bit dissapointed, though our rooms were nice in size it does not even look half as good as the lobby and also house keeping was not really on point, plenty of small but so important details were overlooked. For the rate that we paid, approx, 150€ per night i was suprised that the rooms were so big, our rooms both had a sofa and 2 chairs, considering the rates i must say that if only housekeeping had been on point i would have rated the overall stay much higher. But when the first thing you find when you walk in the room is a used plaster, and even though they have big dispensers of soap you run out, all our empty soda & beer bottles were left in the room, the bathroom in one of our rooms smelled of urine, its just too much to not be bothered about.

Reviews.Title: “Special Treatment at the Hotel Berlin”
Reviews.Author: asocsop1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Berlin as part of a group trip where we were singing with the Berlin Philharmonic. We didn't know what to expect since it was booked through a group agent. The outside of the hotel is not as pleasing as the inside. The rooms were comfortable, spacious and well kept. The reason for my review is the "special treatment" by the housekeeping staff. While I was in Berlin, my husband sent me flowers for our 3rd wedding anniversary. I had his card on the nightstand while we left the room. We came back later in the day and found our room elaborately decorated and setup for an "anniversary room". There was champagne, mixed nuts, apples, yellow roses on the pillows, rose petals on the bed, swan shaped towels, chocolates, slippers and robes and, the best part, flashing pink hearts!! This is NO joke. See the pictures in this review. We called and asked who did this since there was no note. The front desk said they saw it was a wedding anniversary and it was complimentary. My roommate (another girl) and I had a great time and laughed. We also enjoyed the champagne with some other friends. :) The best part was that the housekeeping staff took it upon themselves to do this for "us". We gave them a good tip and will always remember our "anniversary room." I would stay there again if I had the choice next time. Too bad my husband wasn't there with me! Sincerely, Kara

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: bacooper76
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with a large group, and was pleased with the hotel over all. The front desk staff were pleasant answered questions, exchanged money and at one point tried to help us find an adapter. The room was very spacious and comfortable although I will say coming fromt the states it was a little odd not to have a bathcloth as part of your bathroom linens, just something to remember if your staying here. Some friends stayed in the newer part of the hotel and I have to say that our room in the older part of the hotel was much more comfortable and bright with two little balconies. I was not impressed by any of the food that the hotel offered, room service breakfast or the bar. You can find better in all regards near by for a lot less. We walked a good bit the area is nice and quiet. The closest U-Bahn stop is just a couple of blocks from the hotel and a very easy walk, just be mindful of the bike lane, we were nearly killed a couple of times. :D The area felt safe and we walked around day and night four women with out any problems at all. We did however see a couple of prostitutes on the corner at the backside of the hotel 4 out of the 6 nights we were there, not that they caused any trouble but they were there. The little pub on the corner across from the rear of the hotel has good German food and beer and a nice outdoor patio. The tiny Cafe Rosen right next door has good MilcheKaffe in the morning along with a nice pastry for a very reasonable price. We really enjoyed our stay even if we were a few U-Bahn stops from the tourist sites, it was nice and relaxing and the staff was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice - but not a design hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_Swede
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went on a romantic weekend to Berlin and decided to stay at Hotel Berlin. We were very happy with this decision. Being parents with small children we usually are wakened a couple of times a night. Here we had a few nights of wonderful sleep - we really appreciated that the room was very soundproof. Though the hotel is big, and was heavily booked when we stayed there, we did not hear a sound from outside. I also loved the state of the room. It was spacious and seemed recently renovated. The bathroom was spotlessly clean. Breakfast was rich in variety, my only complaint beacause of the booking situation the breakfast room was quite crowded. If you're looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a good location - this is a very good choice. However, the funky photos on the hotel website made us believe that this was some kind of design hotel. This is not the case, the lobby is quite quirky but the rest of the hotel is traditional. Not a problem for us, but if you want to stay in a design hotel you should go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Berlin, great but smokey”
Reviews.Author: mantonandkylie
Reviews.Content: When we walked into the hotel we were stunned. Being on a young people's coach tour we weren't expecting great accommodation. Hotel Berlin was fantastic. The only downfall was that our room smelled strongly of smoke. But you get that problem all over Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: ScotlandGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Decent four star hotel. Smart looking from the inside. Very spacious room. Staff friendly enough. Location good (10/15 minutes from Zoo train station but probably better to get the 100 bus which stops right outside the hotel). Definitely buy a Welcome Card for unlimited public transport and discounts on most museums. Berlin itself is amazing! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “I'd recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ellie11
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Hotel Berlin in a large group and everything about the hotel perfectly fitted our needs. One mistake was to walk from the main station to the hotel, should have taken a taxi as the walk - in the snow - was too far for some of us. The hotel is large with nicely decorated public areas and helpful staff. The hotel bar is a great meeting place but not cheap. The walk to the underground is direct and takes around 10 minutes but the whole of Berlin is then at your disposal. The staff at reception recommended a nearby restaurant for our last evening and it was a fantastic find. There's a fab cocktail bar (Bar am Lutzowplatz?) across the square from the hotel and they do a half price offer most nights - well worth a visit! Our room was in the main wing and while it was huge, it wasn't particularly modern. We had a great sitting area and the room was cosy throughout our stay even though the temperatures outside were well below freezing. Bathroom was nice, view was a concrete block but in all the room met all our requirements. One of our party stayed in the new wing and they had a modernised room with flat screen tv and much more modern furnishings. Breakfast was an expensive addition but extremely tasty, I'd advise trying to get a package that includes breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scotsguy5
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel after seeing it on Octopus so we were not sure what to expect and had seen mixed reviews on trip advisor. When we arrived the receptionist informed us that we had cancelled the booking - which we had not. There was no problem though, she simply found us a room and arranged for the third bed to be brought up although we didn't need it as the room had a great bed settee. Our expereince was very good. the location was great fro Ku'dam - shopping. Bars were close by that we were interested in. Transport links were great - the directions on the hotel website were very accurate. Previous comments read mentioned that it was close to the gay district - it was (ish) Prostitutes were alos mentioned and they were evident at night close by but they were only there looking for kerb crawlers and they did not bother anyone walking around the district The hotel was very clean and the staff very attentive and friendly - they could not be faulted. They gave us infromation when we needed and our luggage was looked after for us on the day we checked out. The room was spacious - only thing lacking was a kettle - coffee from the bar was not great and quite pricey. We only had breakfast booked for the last day and that was enough - there was masses of food and we could not have eaten a lot in the morning so it would have been a waste but it was nice on the last morning as we had a long day ahead. The only down side of the locationis that there is not much around inthe way of getting a coffee or something in the morning - I am always first up and like to go a wander but there was nothing very near. Overall though i would rate this hotel very highly and would recommend it for any type of trip - romantic, business, short break, family...

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and well presented”
Reviews.Author: BarryMip
Reviews.Content: Initially on checking in, we were booked into a dirty room. Not the best start. We returned to reception where they duly apologised and changed our room. The room was just as we expected. Very clean, comfortable bed, superb bathroom and excellent value for money. The lobby and lift area was very clean and had a constant buzz around the place. Ideally situated island bar with plenty of space to find to sit. Breakfast was superb with a wide variety of world breakfasts on offer. My only gripe was that being an Englishman I couldn't find any breakfast tea amongst the other flavours they had. Location was ideal being only a short walking distance to the local under/overground station. The tiergarten was only a 15 min walk also, as was the popular area of West Berlin which was abundant with restaurants and shops. Excellent value for money and would stay here again if returning to this wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nico_ch
Reviews.Content: The inside doesn't look like the outside. Seems the hotel has been refurbished not too long ago, the interior design is nice. The room and bathroom are modern and clean. We didn't have to wait long to check-in/out, but given the size of the hotel I would except some queues during peak hours. The restaurant serves good food but pricey (for Berlin) and the service was very chaotic (they kept forgetting our orders and mixing them). The hotel provides free wifi Internet access, always a bonus point.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Amydol
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Berlin at the beginning and again at the end of our tour, Sept-Oct. '07. It is a large hotel. The lobby and restaurants are very nice. Our room was small but decorated nicely and the bathroom was well equiped. It only had liquid soap in the shower, no toiletries. There was a grocery store nearby and several nice restaurants. It was in a good location for walking. We would stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Was OK”
Reviews.Author: Jinxalberta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights Oct 14th to 17th. The outside looks terrible, like a warehouse, but the inside is fine. The rooms here are huge and bathrooms as well. The only complaint we had were the pillows, or excuse for pillows. The breakfast buffet that was included was fantastic, everything was there.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and confortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wen_kel
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in Aug. We booked our stay through Expedia and got a great deal although we had to pay in advance. The room was very nice and the free Wi Fi was great for sending emails after a day of sire seeing. We found the Hotel was a little expensive for meals so we ate out most nights. We found a grocery store that was 5 mins away by foot so we bought food to make lunch. We did see the tourist buses arrive which made the reception very busy. But this wasn't really an issue for us. We were driving through Europe and had a car, parking at he hotel was 17 Euros a day (very expensive) but because we got a great deal on the room it worked out OK. If we travel again we would would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Central, Comfortable hotel in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: lawn_wood
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel Berlin, Berlin for a week in July 2007. We had chosen it from a search on the Internet and were well pleased with its location, facilities and service. The hotel has WiFi access throughout and was very useful to us during our stay there, in fact, it was one of the reasons the hotel was short-listed in the begining. The Breakfast Dining Room was opened from 6.30 am until 10.30 am. There was a very comprehensive spread of food supplied for Breakfast with at least three Fruit Juices alone. There were plentiful supplies topped up very regularly by the efficient staff. The bed-room was as described with all the facilities necessary to make your stay comfortable. TV, Tea/Coffee making facilities, Bath & Shower complete with Shampoos etc. The only thing that was not functioning was the internal Safe but we were offered the use of the Hotel Safety Deposit Boxes at the Reception for any valuables, etc. The hotel is located on the Bus 100 Route and was convenient and central from that point of view. It is a short stroll to visit KaDeWe Department Store in one direction and Tiergarten in the opposite way. Zoogarten area is also within walking distance from where you can get a bus, etc to almost anywhere in Berlin or Germany indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but caters more for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Steve6696
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel very well placed for the 100 bus. Our room was an upgrade apparently but still quite small. When we were there it was full of conferences who monopolised the staff to a greater extent. We did have a few questions with regard to bike tours, restaurants etc but they really werent interested in helping. Maybe just got them on a bad day. We got a cheap deal through lastminute.com secret hotels site so cant complain. I can thoroughly recommend the Cafe Einstein round the corner (right out of the front of the hotel, right again, first left, 50 yards on the left) for a cheap and very filling brunch. Old building, charming waiters, lovely atmosphere. The fat tire bike tour which we eventually found was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, reasonable location & fairly cheap”
Reviews.Author: ad_herts
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located near to the main shopping area of Berlin - the Kurfurstendamm. The nearest U-Bhf stop is called Nollendorfplatz which is only a short walk from the hotel. Also nearby is the Tiergarten, a large park area in the middle of the city. The staff were very friendly and particularly helpful re. providing maps etc. of Berlin. The main clientele appears to be business people and there were several functions held in the lobby throughout our stay. The hotel is well maintained and very modern throughout. There was a flat-screen television in the room with one English channel and an excellent en-suite. Also a safe and big wardrobe. The bed was a bit firm but the room was of a high standard. We had a 'standard business room' which provided everything we needed. We booked our trip through Expedia (3 nights for price of 2) although breakfast was not included. Breakfast costs 14€ each. There is however a quick-breakfast option available at the bar (a croissant and coffee). A good option is to eat in the restaurant at KaDeWe (department store), open from 10am weekdays and 9.30 on Saturday. We found the immediate area to be somewhat lacking in restaurants/bars. Although we didn't encounter any problems, the surrounding streets appeared to be frequented by 'working girls' at night! The public transport in Berlin is excellent and as most places are a short tube ride away. Walking to Brandenburg Gate via the Tiergarten took perhaps 35 minutes. This would be a good base for a shopping trip, as well as for sightseeing. There are more centrally located hotels, but the prices rise accordingly. Tip - get a 'Welcome Card'. This gives you 48 or 72 hours free public transport (U-Bhf and S-Bhf trains) and substantial discount to many attractions and museums. Don't forget to validate your ticket in the machine on the platform the first time you use it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Malte74
Reviews.Content: Booked a double room for two nights through lastminute.com (top secret hotel) for 150 Euro (without breakfast). We were very happy with our stay, nice room, free wifi. Good location, short walk to U-bahn, some nice bars and restaurants nearby. Try "Bar am Lutzowplatz" for great drinks. Didn´t try the hotel restaurant or bar, seemed a bit pricey. Overall a very nice weekend in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: Mila016
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Berlin for three nights (August 16-19th, 2007). I had great expectations for this hotel since the reviews were pretty good. I was disappointed for the following reasons: 1-the nearest u-bahn station was a good walk away 2-there was nothing around the hotel (no grocery stores, no entertainment). The hotel seems to be situated in a business district. 3-the hotel overcharged for everything, knowing that tourists would pay since there were no services available nearby. For example, breakfast was 17 euro per person..., 2 euro to get a pair of socks washed... 4-the minute it got dark outside, prostitutes lined up on the street of the hotel, one block away. 5-unfriendly and rude customer service. The attendant cleaning the room in the morning was the nicest person I encountered at the hotel. Overall, I feel I paid too much for what I got. I value location over almost everything else, and I felt the hotel was very poorly located. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed: 3 star quality in a 4 star skin”
Reviews.Author: markfour
Reviews.Content: This hotel tries for a trendy boutique surface, but underneath the gloss are a number of problems. First, there are not enough people at the front desk. A tour bus arrived right before we did, and there were thirty people waiting to register, and only two people on the desk, with no queuing system so some people elbowed their way to the front of the line, raising the frustration level. Later in our stay, there was always a wait at reception. Other problems: the air conditioning has an automatic shutoff, and only one setting--on or off. So at night, you have to get up and turn it on again every few hours. The water in the shower can go from hot to cold in a split second, and never stays the same temperature for very long. The fitness center consists of: a treadmill, a stationery bicycle, some dumbbells and a second rate universal gym. And the restaurant was spotty. The main course was a lowlight (overcooked fish), the desserts were excellent. Another problem was the location. It sounds great: the middle of Berlin. But to quote Gertrude Stein, there's no there there. There are low rise office buildings, but no shops or restaurants in the immediate vicinity. Lutzowplatz, the square the hotel borders on is overgrown with weeds. There are some nice stores and cafes past the subway station, about five blocks away. On the other side of the coin, our maid was very responsive when we put out the sign for cleaning. The reception area staff were friendly, helpful and fluent in English (once you waited in line to speak with them). The wireless internet was free, and worked without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, deserves 4*s”
Reviews.Author: Gandhiji
Reviews.Content: The hotel Berlin in Berlin is truly a 4 star hotel. If I come back to Berlin, I would be more than happy to stay there again. The best was the full hearty hot and cold buffet breakfast. If you eat well, you could even skip lunch! The hot breakfast included scrambled eggs, boiled eggs, sausages, bacon, and cheesy tomatoes. The double room was spacious, but in comparison the single room was a bit on the small side. Only some of the rooms have a balcony. You can have a choice of smoking or non-smoking rooms. The inward facing rooms overlook the hotel garden, and the outside facing rooms overlook either the car park or the main road. The hotel and rooms were very clean and tidy. The location of the hotel was good but not right in the centre. Outside the hotel is a bus stop which has fast frequent services to the west and east of the city. The nearest underground station is about 10 minutes walk away. Public transport is cheap and reliable. There are not many shops near the hotel. Do not use the currency exchange service at the hotel, unless you have to. The rate is very poor. There is no swimming pool at the hotel. The hotel bar is good but full of smokers. Read my review about Berlin for information about sightseeing and transport in Berlin. Enjoy the hotel and holiday. We did!

Reviews.Title: “a disaster”
Reviews.Author: gerrybee
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the reception with a party of 12 to find that the reservations had not been processed and our rooms were not ready ,this was at 1400 were then told to come back in four hours..not good so far .On returning to the hotel to be told the reception did not know if the rooms were ready. this was a lie we kew this because a member of our party is involved with the hotel industry and he spotted the unprocessed checkin documents on the reception desk..! we had to wait another two hours befor we were even told what was going on. reception was a mess. when the manager was asked for the receptionist was sent out and was very rude and unhelpful in the mater. While we all found the staff in general very nice and helpful. reception and management was arrogant and rude i could not recomend this hotel as a good place to stay in berlin. In my opinion this hotel did not give me the four star experience i had paid for and left berlin very dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jtriefen
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent price, nice facilities, very clean and friendly staff. The rooms are a bit small, but the bathroom was plently big. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tadgh1975
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for a long weekend in May. We booked through the Ryan Air website and got a very good deal. We found the hotel was to a high standard. It was quite busy when we were there catering for conferences. Our room was very big and quiet and it was very clean and looked like it had been done up not so long ago. The location is ideal for sight seeing in the city and there is an excellent bar literally across from the hotel in Lutzowplatz that is ideal for cocktails and in staggering distance of the hotel. We didn't eat at the hotel but tried the restaurant Lochner in Lutzowplatz which was very nice and the staff were very attentive and helpful. Was a bit apprehensive with regard to whether I would enjoy Berlin but I would definitely recommend this hotel and the city, lots to do and the people are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: cow_manx
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel, wonderfully located in downtown Berlin within walking distance of the Hard Rock Café and several other attractions. It's very high end, ironically reminds me of the Hotel Vancouver back home. The on-site dining had a limited selection and I found the cuisine to be a bit lacking. The room numbering and elevator system seemed overly complex and we got lost a couple times looking for our room. In the end though it was a wonderful facility, I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: timh65
Reviews.Content: This hotel is known as Hotel Berlin-Berlin. Good size clean rooms. Nice bar and helpful staff.
